The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk and reduce carriage cost. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Lista

texts.en:
Lista is a 21-year-old young woman. She is single and lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Lista has had the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. 

Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2011 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Lista would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Lista will use the Kiva loan to purchase more chemicals, chick feed, broiler concentrate, and fencing to increase production. 

She hopes to put her two children and two cousins through school.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed, broiler concentrate and fencing.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 23 years old, married and a mother of one. She lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe, and is an entrepreneur working with other young women in her rural community, encouraging them to be economically independent. 

She supports her family by selling fish, such as dried kapenta (a small, sardine-like fish) and dried bream in nearby towns. She started her business in 2011 when she started facing financial difficulties, and it has enabled her to support her family and provide for their basic needs. 

Hope knows there is a high demand for the fish she sells. With this Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk at fisheries. This will help boost her profits and enable her to raise enough money to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Ruth is already an experienced entrepreneur in Wedza District, Zimbabwe with four years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table in the local flea market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. It has enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.  Ruth also volunteers in schools counselling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates. 

With the Kiva loan, Ruth will purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably and take her one step closer to her dream of owning a store one day. This will bring stability to her business that will enable her to secure her children’s education and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her stock in her shop.

loans.name: Tabeth

texts.en:
Tabeth is 18 years old and a single young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide and an entrepreneur. 

She started her poultry business in January, 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for chickens and saw it as an opportunity. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks, and sells them to local customers.  

Tabeth knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. 

With this loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.  

With a Kiva loan investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Salapateh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Salapateh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 1,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The featured leader of this group is Rugiatu. Rugiatu is a native of Portloko, in northern Sierra Leone.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Rugiatu sells pineapples, bananas, plantains, etc. and has been doing this type of business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy pineapples, bananas, plantains, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, bananas, plantains, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is single with no children, and she doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent. 

She operates a kiosk, and has been in this business for one year. She works in a shop six days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes transportation and on and off electricity. She is aspires to increase her sales to boost her business.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more juice, cooking oil, sweet bananas, biscuits, and boxes of bottled water. .

loans.use: To buy more packed juice, cooking oil, sweet bananas, biscuits, and boxes of bottled water.

loans.name: Haawa

texts.en:
Haawa is divorced, with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells fish at the market and has been in this business for ten years. 

Haawa has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more baskets of fish. She moves door-to-door, seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a fully-stocked stall, selling both fresh and dried fish. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila, es soltera, no posee ayuda del extranjero, vive junto a su madre, para cubrir sus gastos personales y los gastos de su hogar ella por iniciativa propia instalo una pupuseria en su casa, la cual atiende de 4:00 p.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m., por el momento esta actividad no le ha representado ningún problema.
Comprará maíz, frijol, chicharrón, repollos, tomates, quesillo y aderezos; estos ingredientes son parte de su materia prima para que el negocio funcione, espera aumentar sus ganancias, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su servicio.
Anhela ampliar su negocio y  mejorar su economía para darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Zoila is single and does not have help from relatives living abroad. She lives with her mother. In order to cover her personal and household expenses, she took the initiative to create a shop in her house selling pupusas. She operates the business from 4:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. So far she has had no major problems. She will use the loan funds in order to purchase corn, beans, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and salad dressings. These ingredients are essential for her business. She hopes to improve her earnings, attract new customers, and improve her level of service. She wishes to expand her business and help to improve her family's finances and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and salad dressings.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 23-year-old farmer living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She owns a small scale plot where she has been farming tobacco for the past year. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and support the local community by employing four workers.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk and reduce carriage cost. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 30 years old and a mother of two from the Wedza District, Zimbabwe.  She is currently operating a buy and sell business at a local flea market. She sells cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts. She started the business in January, and has been so successful that she has employed two people. 

When she is not at work, she volunteers at local schools offering counselling services to troubled students and cleaning classrooms. 

Priscilla dreams of being economically independent and opening her own store one day. 

With the requested loan, she intends to purchase additional cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably by bringing her the stability needed to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts

loans.name: Enthinia

texts.en:
Enthinia is 35 years old and lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. Enthinia is passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s well-being. 

She rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets for a living. She started the business in 2005 after her husband lost his job. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 

Enthinia intends to use the loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her living standards and to create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Blanca Liseth

texts.es:
Blanca, es una joven que a su corta edad de 18 años de edad ya tiene su propio hogar, es casada, tiene dos hijos, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras junto a su madre, el negocio ya tiene dos años de estar funcionando, lo atienden de lunes a sábado.
Con el préstamo comprara jocotes, piñas, papayas, pepinos, repollos, cebollas, etc., con lo que surtirá su negocio de productos de mayor calidad, espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, y tener una economía más estable.
Sueña con tener el negocio activo para obtener los ingresos necesarios para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is an 18 year old young woman who already has her own home.  She is married, has two children and sells fruits and vegetables with her mother.  The business is two years old and they work it Monday through Saturday.

She will use the money from this loan to buy plumbs, pineapples, cucumbers, cabbage, onions, etc. so she can stock her business with better quality products, meet her customers’ needs, increase her sales and have better financial stability.

She dreams of having an active business to obtain the necessary income so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, está acompañado, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para cubrir los gastos de su familia se dedica a vender ropa, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., por el momento no le ha representado ninguna dificultad realizarla.
Invertirá en la compra de variedad de ropa como: blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, calzonetas, con lo que surtirá el negocio para estas fechas de fin de año que es cuando aumenta sus demandas, espera aumentar sus ingresos, tener más clientes satisfechos y cancelar con responsabilidad la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más fortalecido que le dé más ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and is the father of two children, ages 8 and 9 and doesn’t get any outside assistance to cover the family expenses.  He sells clothing from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm and he has not had any difficulties to date.

He will buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, and undergarments to stock his store for the end of year season, when his customer demand goes up.  He hopes to increase his income, have more customers, and pay off the loan responsibly.  He wants to have a stronger business that will provide more earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elsi Noemy

texts.es:
Elsi, vive en una casa familiar, es soltera no posee ayuda del extranjero, para apoyar con los gastos de la casa ella se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz), por su experiencia no ha tenido ningún problema en realizarla.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas insecticidas, con lo que espera tener una cosecha abundante, granos de mucha calidad, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía y continuar cubriendo parte de los gastos de su hogar.
Anhela mejorar su productividad para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Elsi is single and lives with one of her relatives.  She does not have any help from relatives living abroad.  In order to help with the household expenses, she grows corn.  She has had no problems in doing this.

She will invest in compost, fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides, with the aim of obtaining a good harvest with high-quality crops.  This will lead to increased sales and income, and allow her to continue to cover a portion of the household expenses.

She dreams of increasing her productivity so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.ru: Саадат 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Саадат - средне-специальное образование, сразу после окончания школы Саадат поступила в товароведческий техникум, окончила техникум в 1986 году и проработала в магазине в сфере торговли 1 год. Затем Саадат вышла замуж за Тулебека и после распада Союза они начали заниматься сельским хозяйством, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Саадат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 35 овец, а также 2,0 ГА поливной земли на которой они выращивают клевер и фасоль. Супруг и сын Саадат работают в лесхозе и имеют ежемесячную зарплату. Саадат занимается домашним хозяйством. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саадат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Саадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение младшей дочери.
texts.en: Saadat is 46 years old, married, and raising four children. Saadat has a vocational education. After graduation, Saadat entered merchandising college, graduated from college in 1986 and worked in a trade shop for one year. Then, Saadat married Tulebek.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, they started farming, having purchased cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Saadat's hard work, her farm now has 2 dairy cows, 35 sheep, and 2 hectares of irrigated land on which they grow clover and beans. Saadat's husband and son work in forestry and have a monthly salary. Saadat is a housekeeper.  Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to further grow her household, Saadat has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan - for the purchase of cattle for cattle breeding. Saadat plans to invest the loan income into increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save money to pay for the education of her younger daughter.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар 52 года, вдова, одна воспитала сына. Сыну 26 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей проживает вместе с Чынар и помогает ей по хозяйству. У Чынар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынар занимается животноводством, стартовав 1 год назад, с покупки коровы на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок. Корова в день дает 15 литров молока, Чынар ежедневно сдает реализаторам по 20 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Также сын помогает матери материально. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynar is a 52 year old widow, who has raised one son by herself. Her son is 26 years old, married and has 2 children.  He lives with Chynar and helps her with the housework. Chynar has a secondary education. In order to make money to support the family, Chynar raises livestock. She started one year ago, with the purchase of a cow for 50,000 KGS. Thanks to Chynar's hard work, today she has one dairy cow and one bull. The cow gives 15 liters of milk per day. Every day, Chynar gives dairy processers 20 KGS. The monthly income from the sale of milk is 9,000 KGS. Her son also helps her financially. In order to further grow her business, Chynar has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of sheep for fattening and re-selling. Chynar plans to invest the loan income in further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and intends to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Audelia Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Audelia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Mi Crédito ya que ha logrado surtir sus productos y aumentar las ventas. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz empacado, Azúcar, Aceite entre otros; con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Audelia is originally from the city of Granada. She is a merchant by trade and manages a grocery business.

Audelia is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she will be able to restock with more products and increase her sales. She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy products such as packaged rice, sugar, oil, and other products. In the end, she hopes to meet the demand of her customers.

Audelia believes the loan will be of great help because she will be able to generate better earnings and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy packaged rice, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Dadokhon

texts.ru:
Дадохону из района Исфары 35 лет. У него большая семья, состоящая из родителей, сестры, брата и жены. Дадохон женат на Зухро. Ей 32 года. Брат Дадохона живет и работает за приделами страны, он уехал, чтобы прокормить свою семью. 
  Дадохон до недавних пор нигде не работал. Он решил начать свой бизнес, точнее открыть собственный продуктовый магазин. Дадохон ответственно относится к своей будущей деятельности и по фотографии можно увидеть, что он уже обустроил свой магазин, построил полки и купил холодильник. Но для закупа первого товара ему не хватает средств. Он обратился за помощью с большой надеждой на Вашу поддержку. Он очень верит, что ему помогут. Дадохон хочет сам зарабатывать, кормить свою большую семью и стать ответственным отцом.
texts.en: Dadokhon is 35 years old and from the Isfara district. He has a large family, consisting of parents, sister, brother and his wife. Dadokhon is married to Zuhro. She is 32 years old. Dadokhon's brother lives and works abroad in order to feed his family. Until recently, Dadokhon did not work. He decided to start a business, specifically, open his own grocery store. Dadokhon has a responsible attitude towards his future business and photos show that he has set up his shop, built shelves and bought a refrigerator. However, he lacks the funds for the purchase of his first merchandise. He has asked for help with great hope for your support. He strongly believes that he can be helped. Dadokhon wants to earn money to feed his large family and be a responsible father.

loans.use: To open a grocery store and purchase the first merchandise

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married with two children living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a learner guide volunteering at schools in her community. 

Over the past two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2010 when her family began to face financial difficulties.

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Angeline would very much like to increase her sales volumes and become a supplier to major supermarkets. 

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and put them through school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Ligia Tatiana

texts.es:
Ligia, es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, ella es soltera y no posee otro tipo de ingreso más el que ella genera con la crianza y venta de pollos, es una actividad que e inicio por cuenta propia debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para los gastos familiares.
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra de pollos, concentrado y malla, con lo que fortalecerá el negocio y mejorara la infraestructura del mismo, espera aumentar la producción, tener mejores ventas y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Sueña con fortalecer poco a poco el negocio y dar a sus hijos mejor salud, educación, alimentación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Ligia is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. She is single and has no other type of income other than what she earns raising and selling chickens. It is an activity that she started on her own because of the need to generate income for household expenses.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of chickens, animal feed and wire mesh which will strengthen the business and improve its infrastructure. She hopes to increase production to have better sales and higher earnings.

She dreams of strengthening the business little by little and offering her children better health, education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed and wire mesh.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бурул - среднее образование, по характеру Бурул очень целеустремленная, предприимчивая, неустанно трудится во благо своей семьи. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурул занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Старший сын Бурул работает в столице Кыргызстана, помогает семье материально. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Burul is 45 years old, married, and raising three children. Burul has a secondary education.  By nature Burul is very purposeful and resourceful, working tirelessly for the benefit of her family. As the main income for her family, Burul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 19 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Burul's hard work, her farm now has 2 dairy cows. Burul's eldest son works in the Kyrgyz capital and helps the family financially. Burul's monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further grow her business, Burul has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of steers to increase the amount livestock. Burul plans to invest the loan income in further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to pay for higher education for her children.

loans.use: to buy gobies

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members apart from her children. 

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and begin going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El señor Eloy tiene 41 años, casado con un hijo que tiene la edad de 18 años, él trabaja como en una entidad pública como policía, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Eloy va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que el señor Eloy tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Eloy, age 41, is married and has an 18 year old son.  Eloy works as a public employee as a policeman.  This is his first loan with the institution.  Eloy is going to use the loan to finish installing water in his home.  They only have a well, and it is a lot of work transporting the water.  He will build a connection for the bathrooms, shower, and kitchen.  This way he will provide his family with greater comfort.  There are many reasons that the area where he lives does not have basic services.  However, this will not stop Eloy from having potable water in his home.  He is very happy for the opportunity provided to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing water in his home.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул опытная и умелая швея. Она продолжает свое швейное дело и сейчас повторно обращается за кредитом. Первый кредит она брала на покупку тканей. Теперь она на сумму второго кредита хочет купить себе новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Ее собственная швейная машинка очень устарела и по этой причине процесс ее работы идет медленно. Мавчигул решила расширить свою деятельность. С помощью новой машинки она сможет брать больше заказов на шитье платьев и ей будет помогать дочь. Она верит, что и в этот раз Кредиторы Kiva поддержат ее.
texts.en: Mavchigul is an experienced and skilled seamstress. She continues to sew and now again would like to take a loan. She took her first loan to buy fabric. Now she would like to take a second loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine. Her own sewing machine is very old and for this reason her work goes slowly. Mavchigul decided to expand her business. With the aid of a new sewing machine she will be able to take larger orders to sew dresses and her daughter can help her. She believes that this time Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Fungisai

texts.en:
Fungisayi is 21 years old and a single mother of one. She lives in eastern Zimbabwe in Wedza District. 

She currently operates a takeaway food shop from a shack at the Wedza Center. She offers a menu that includes sadza (cornmeal), rice, beef, vegetables, chicken, and fish and chips. She started the business after finishing school in 2010. During school, she learned about food production and nutrition.

A Kiva loan offers her an opportunity to improve her business by relocating to the local food court, which is more hygienic. In addition, she will purchase more ingredients for the dishes she offers on her menu. 

Fungisayi anticipates that these changes will help increase business by attracting more customers. She will use the proceeds to support herself and her child’s continuing education.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es: José un joven de 19 años de edad,  soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente pertenece al  grupo “Los Progresistas” conformado por 08 socios responsables que pasan a su 2do ciclo. José cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda, la cual lleva 07 meses con dicho negocio. Se siente feliz pues a su corta edad a llegado  tener una estabilidad económica, la cual le permite seguir apoyando a su madre.  El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Los Progresistas” a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. José es el primero del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco y pantalón a cuadros.
texts.en: José is 19 years old, single, and does not have children.  He currently belongs to the "Los Progresistas" group, which has eight responsible members who are starting their second loan cycle.  José has had a store in his home for seven months and is happy that, at such a young age, he has managed to gain financial stability, which allows him to to continue supporting his mother.  José is applying for a loan that he will use to buy groceries, sweets, and drinks.  His biggest wish is to continue improving his business.  The "Los Progresistas" group thanks those who are making this loan possible.  In the photo, José is the first on the left, wearing a white t-shirt and checked trousers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.en:
The women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Palmas” are from the rural state of Quiche (pronounced “key-che”) in the northwestern highlands of Guatemala. The group is composed of 12 women who earn their living from raising animals like cattle, pigs, turkeys, ducks and chickens. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with Friendship Bridge. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new year with solid goals and dreams.

Josefa is a 24-year-old married mother of three children who range in age from four to six. She completed three years of formal education but due to the poor economical condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of Friendship Bridge, Josefa realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her children. She shares that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her first child in school this year! Her husband shares the same goals for the children. Josefa raises animals like bulls, pigs and chickens. She is applying for a loan with Friendship Bridge which will be her second loan cycle. The requested funds will be used to purchase two bulls as well as feed to fatten all the animals. With an optimistic spirit and positive attitude, Josefa looks forward to this new year with its challenges, blessings and successes.

All of the women of the Trust Bank “Las Palmas” look forward to their monthly meetings.  During these meetings, held with a Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge, the ladies learn about topics like budget administration (first topic of the year), debt, health and nutrition, and self-esteem. The combination of loans and education is a recipe for empowerment for the women of the Trust Bank!

On behalf of her colleagues, Josefa expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from KIVA investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support. In addition, the ladies send greetings to all for a happy, healthy and successful new year!

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 39 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child and sells assorted goods to earn a living. She has had this business for nine years. Each month, she earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Ailyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business further.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Sad 3 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 3 est composé de 10personnes qui habitent dans le même village et faisant pour la plus part la même activité. Son président s’appelle Arona et on le reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Il est marié et père de famille et évolue dans l’agriculture de maraichage. Il a juste besoin du crédit pour acheter des intrants et semences pour développer son maraichage. Il prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.  Il a une expérience de 15ans et commence sa journée à 6h pour la finir à 19h. A l’avenir il voudrait moderniser son périmètre agricole pour fournir des légumes de qualité à ses clients.
texts.en:
The EIG [Economic Interest Group] SAD 3 is made of 10 people who live in the same village and for the most part practice the same activity. Its president is named Arona and one can identify him on the photo by his raised hand. 

He is married and a father and he works in market-gardening agriculture. He just needs this loan to purchase inputs and seeds to develop his market gardening. He provides for the family’s daily expenses. He has 15 years of experience, and begins his day at 6 am to finish at 7 pm. In the future he would like to modernize its agricultural area to provide his customers with quality vegetables.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds to practice market gardening.

loans.name: Milagro Sulema

texts.es:
La señora  Milagro de 53 años de edad es casada tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, carnes , frescos, golosinas.
Doña Milagro es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos que están estudiando, su venta es en su casa y también de forma ambulante, es discapacitada mas sin embargo es un ejemplo de optimismo y responsabilidad ya que es una de la mejores clientes que tiene Prisma y es muy luchadora, también crece cerdos para destazo.
Doña Milagro está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, frescos, churros, verduras,  etc. Con el  apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar también su condición de vida, ya que desea vender bastante para esta época de  navidad.
Doña Milagro su sueño es tener mejor su casa y también tiene un buen proyecto de una porqueriza que desea hacerla crecer al igual que su pulpería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Milagro is 53 years old, married and has two children who depend on her. She lives in the San Lorenzo community in the south of Honduras.  Milagro has her own house and, for four years, she has had a store selling groceries, meat, fresh food, and sweets.

Milagro is an enterprising woman with a desire to help her children, currently in school, to prosper.  She sells from her home and as a street vendor.  Milagro is disabled but an optimist and responsible.  She is one of Prisma's best customers and very plucky.  She also raises pigs to slaughter.

Milagro is applying for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, fresh foods, churros, vegetables, and more.  With this support of this loan, Milagro intends on improving her income and, therefore, her quality of life.  She wants to to sell a lot during this Christmas season.

Milagro's dream is to improve her house.  She also wants to expand her pigs business, as well as her grocery store.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, fresh foods, churros, vegetables, and more for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 68 years old and lives in Silongon, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lolita has a sari-sari store; she sells assorted goods to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 68 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Philippines. She is widowed with five children. To earn a living, Fely has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this work. Fely has requested a loan to buy additional snack ingredients.

Fely has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she would like to support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to buy additional snack ingredients.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 29-year-old wife and mother of two living in Wedza District. She is a Cama community health trainer working with schools in her community. In 2011, Florence started a market garden and poultry business when her family started facing financial difficulties. She is currently producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Florence would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major international supermarkets such as TM and Spar. Florence will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and her two cousins and put them through school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is 34 years old and married, with three children. As a committed leader, she organizes and heads school clean-up campaigns as well as donates stationery and pays school fees for some of the orphans and vulnerable children in the community. Judith is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets to the community. She has been running this business for seven years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Judith plans to purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her stall

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en:
Thandiwe is 28 years old and married, with three children. She is currently living in Hurungwe, a district in northern Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a learner guide in schools, teaching students life skills as a part of their education. Thandiwe is also the area chairperson of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network in Hurungwe. In addition to her extensive involvement as a community volunteer, she operates a store that sells kitchenware, such as dinner plates, china, cutlery and teacups. Thandiwe inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur.  

Thandiwe intends to use the Kiva loan to stock up on china, dinnerware and cutlery in order to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Koshaly

texts.ru: Кошалы 60 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Кошалы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кошалы занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кошалы, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойных коров, 25 овец, 4 лошади. Кошалы очень предприимчивый и целеустремленный. Всегда старается достичь всех поставленных целей. Супруга и дети помогают по хозяйству. Супруга доит коров и сдает реализаторам. Сам Кошалы пасет весь свой скот и заготавливает корма на зиму. Дети убираются в хлеву и меняют воду. Все условия для скота имеются. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кошалы обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кошалы планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Koshaly is 60 years old and is raising three children with his spouse. He has a high school education and is the main breadwinner for his family. For 30 years Koshaly has raised livestock, starting with buying cattle for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to his hard work, he now has four dairy cows, 25 sheep and four horses. 

He is very enterprising and purposeful and always tries to reach his goals. His wife and children help with the livestock. His wife milks the cows and delivers the milk. Koshaly himself takes the cattle out to graze and prepares food in the winter. His children clean the stables and change the water. The livestock have everything they need. 

Their monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to support his household, Koshaly took a loan from the microfinance organization, Bai-Tushum and Partners, to buy a cow for breeding. He will use the income from the loan to invest in increasing his herd and to save to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Ильхомчон 38-летний скотовод, проживающий в городе Конибодом. У него жена и трое детей. Вместе сними также живет его мать. Ильхомчон вместе с матерью занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Они разводят бычков для дальнейшей продажи. Этой деятельностью они занимаются более 8 лет. Кроме того, Ильхомчон еще и занимается растениеводством. Сейчас он просит кредит для развития своего животноводческого бизнеса. На сумму кредита Ильхомчон хочет приобрести пару бычков и корм для скота. Обычно Ильхомчон закупает молодых бычков, откармливает их в течение 30-35 дней и продает на скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. 
Сейчас Ильхомчонн нуждается в данном кредите, поскольку в его скотном дворе остался всего один бычок, которого вы видите на фотографии.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is a 38-year-old cattleman living in the town of Konibodom. He has a wife and three children. His mother also lives with them. Ilhomjon and his mother have raised cattle for more than eight years. They raise calves to sell. 

In addition, Ilhomjon is involved in agriculture. Now he is asking for a loan to expand his livestock business. With the loan he would like to buy a pair of calves and feed for the cattle. Usually he buys young calves, feeds them for 30-35 days and then sells them at the cattle market at a profit. Ilhomjon needs to take this loan because he only has one calf left in his yard (which is shown in the photograph).

loans.use: To purchase a pair of calves and cattle feed to expand his business.

loans.name: Sad 4 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 4 est composé de 9 personnes qui habitent le même village et partagent leur champs. Leur président s’appelle Badara, il est marié et père de famille. Il pratique la culture du maraichage et sollicite ce montant  pour acheter des semences et intrants pour cultiver son champ. Il gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Il commence sa journée à6h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir il voudrait augmenter son périmètre agricole afin de pouvoir diversifier sa production et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
The EIG [Economic Interest Group] SAD 4 is made up of 9 persons who live in the same village and share their fields. Their president is named Badara, he is married and a father. He practices market-gardening and he is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and inputs to cultivate his field.

He manages the family’s daily expenses and he has over 10 years of experience in this activity. He begins his day at 6 am to finish at 7 pm. In the future he would like to increase his agricultural area in order to diversify his production and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs to practice market gardening.

loans.name: Sad 5 Group

texts.fr: L e GIE SAD 5 est composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier  et pratiquent la même activité. Le président s’appelle Souleymane qui a levé la main sur la photo. Il évolue dans la culture maraichère et a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des semences  et intrant ; marié et père de famille, il gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin et la finir à 18h. Il souhaite à l’avenir devenir le fournisseur potentiel de légumes dans tout le village.
texts.en: The EIG [Economic Interest Group] SAD 5 is made up of 10 persons who live in the same district and practice the same activity. The president is named Souleymane whose hand is raised on the photo.  He works in market gardening and needs this loan to buy seeds and inputs. He is married and a father. He manages the family's daily expenses. He begins his day at 6 am to finish at 6 pm. In the future he would like to become the vegetable supplier for the whole village.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs to practice market gardening.

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru: Амриддину 21 год. Он проживает в городе Душанбе. Для Амриддина это не просто город, в этом месте он родился, вырос, учиться и работает. Он живет с родителями. Его родители воспитали его быть ответственным, честным и целеустремленным. Амриддин учится в Технологическом Университете города Душанбе в 4том курсе. Параллельно он работает в сфере электроснабжения. Работать он начал более одного года назад. Амриддин хочет после окончания Университета остаться работать в этой сфере. Из-за того, что он еще не оплатил учебный год, Амриддина могут отчислить из Университета  и его не возьмут на работу. Амриддин обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить учебный год. Помогите ему.
texts.en:
Amriddin is 21 years old and lives in the city of Dushanbe.  For him, Dushanbe is not just a city.  It is a special place where he was born, where he grew up, and where he is now studying and working.

Amriddin still lives with his parents who have taught him to be responsible, honest and goal-oriented.  He is currently enrolled as a fourth-year student at the Technological University in Dushanbe.  In addition to his studies, he has also been working in the field of electrical power supply for over a year. 

After graduation, Amriddin would like to continue working in his current field.  Because he hasn't paid his yearly tuition fees yet, he might be expelled from university and lose his job.  He is taking a loan to pay for his college tuition.  He needs your help.

loans.use: to pay his college yearly tuition.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 36-year-old young woman who is married with two children. She lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe and volunteers at the local clinic and schools, offering cleaning services in her community. Since 2012 she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2011 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Since poultry production is a prosperous business in her community, Jessica would like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets such as TM in Zimbabwe and Spar, an international store. Jessica will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and her two cousins and put them through school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Aplonia

texts.en:
Aplonia is 22 years old and lives in the Wedza District. She volunteers at the local center for vulnerable children in the community. She is also a Learner Guide striving to improve the wel-being of students in local schools. For the past three years she has been in the tobacco farming business. This has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and employ two people to help her on her plot.

The requested Kiva loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk as well as pesticide. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco seeds.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of fabric. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a tailoring school. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire additional capital. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Sithulisiwe

texts.en:
Sithulisiwe is 22 years old and lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is a Community Health Development officer striving to improve the health and well-being of her community. For the past five years she has been in the tobacco farming business. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and employ six people on her farm.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk and fertilizer. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of six children; two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop where her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda. She has been in this business for four years. 

Agnes has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt. She works in a shop that she rents, and works there seven days every week. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to see her business grow big so she can become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Fadziso

texts.en:
Fadziso is 26 years old and lives in Wedza District in Zimbabwe. She volunteers at the local clinic sharing information about health and well-being. For the past five years, she has been in the tobacco farming business. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds and fertilizer. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco seeds.

loans.name: Tilda

texts.en:
Tilda is 19 years old and lives in the District of Hurungwe in Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools disseminating health information to students. 

Tilda also runs a flea market, where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2012 to support her three siblings. She is the main breadwinner in the family. 

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business, and she would like to expand. The loan will assist her to get more jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. 

She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for her flea market.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
Nomatter is a 30-year-old businesswoman and the mother of one. She lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. Nomatter is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school. 

She owns and runs a flea-market stand at the local business center where she sells clothing, accessories and shoes. 

She started the business in 2010 when she was married and started facing financial difficulties. Currently, Nomatter’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Nomatter can purchase large bales of clothing to increase her supply and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for her and her child’s needs. 

She hopes to someday grow the business and create employment opportunities in her community

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothing for her stall

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is from Plaridel. She sells fish to support her five children. She is 47 years old and can barely make ends meet, being a widow. Her income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month is not enough, and she has to labor hard to support her family's needs, especially the education of her children.

Bobby is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell. She wants to increase her inventory in order to earn more profit. Bobby knows that if she does not work hard, she will not be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy "banyeras" of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: Jacquiline is 35 years old and has two school-aged children. She assists her husband in providing for their family's needs by selling fish, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has enjoyed her membership with Paglaum MPC for ten years now. She relies on the cooperative to help her meet her funding needs. She is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP. She wants to buy a motor vehicle to be used for her fish-selling business. She hopes to expand her business to nearby municipalities.

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle for her business.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida  is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She has no other family members to take care of. 

She has a business of selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She works at the market six days out of every week.  

Rashida has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for charcoal. 

She resides in her family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vladimir Manuel

texts.es:
Vladimir Manuel es un joven estudiante de Sistema y Computación, que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Soy Vladimir Manuel, tengo 18 años de edad y resido en Santo Domingo Este junto a mis padres y mi hermano menor; he crecido bajo el apoyo de mi familia inculcándome los valores y el camino correcto.
Desde mis inicios en la escuela siempre he logrado buenas calificaciones y siempre salía airoso cada año. Al culminar la secundaria me tracé una nueva meta, que es ser un profesional y estudiar en una universidad privada la carrera de mi sueño que es ingeniería en sistema, pero se me ha presentado el primer obstáculo, pues no tengo los recursos económicos para sustentarla debido a que actualmente de los 4 que vivimos en mi hogar solamente está laborando mi madre, la cual ha puesto todo su empeño para sacarnos adelante inculcándonos valores y desafiando la situación económica que actualmente nos están atacando; no obstante a su esfuerzo sus ingresos no dan para ella mantener un hogar que cuenta con 4 personas incluyéndola ya que los ingresos vienen por un cuidado que ella le da a personas ancianas. 
Por esa razón me dirigí a fundapec para adquirir  un crédito educativo Kiva poniendo fe y esperanza de que no hay nada imposible sino los proponemos. Estoy convencido de que la educación es la base del desarrollo y yo como joven quiero tener un mejor futuro que los jóvenes del sector donde vivo y demostrar que si se puede salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades, con empeño y deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Vladimir Manuel is a young man studying Computer Systems. He is requesting this loan to cover education costs. This is his story:

I am Vladimir Manuel. I am 18 years old and live in Santo Domingo with my parents and younger brother. I grew up with my parents instilling me with good values that put me on the right path.

Since I started school, I always got good grades and was successful every year. After I finished secondary school, I had another goal: to be a professional and study at a private university. My dream career is in Systems Engineering, but this presented my first obstacle because I don't have the economic resources to afford it. Of the four of us who live in my household, my mother is the only one who works. She has put all her efforts into moving us forward and instilling us with values, challenging our economic situation. Despite her efforts, her income isn't enough to sustain a household of four. Her income comes from taking care of the elderly.

For this reason, I came to Fundapec to request a Kiva education loan in the hopes that nothing is impossible if you ask. I am convinced that education is the foundation for development and I, as a young person, want to have a better future than the youth who live in my neighborhood. I want to demonstrate that it is possible to move forward despite the difficulties if you make the effort and have a desire to succeed.

loans.use: to pay for school registration to study Computer Systems

loans.name: Loreen

texts.en:
Loreen is a 19-year-old single young woman who lives the Hurungwe District in northern Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization.  She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges in her community.

She also operates a grocery shop, where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (coarse flour made from maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, and sweets. 

Loreen inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for four years and has managed to employ two people during that time. 

Loreen would use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is an 18-year-old single young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe  She helps young people in her community by conducting life skills education classes.

In addition to being a community role model, she started her poultry business in August after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. Rumbidzai currently produces about 115 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Rumbidzai knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she could invest in growing her business. However, all her income is needed to provide for her two children who are dependent upon her. 

With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase, and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hermano y sus hijos, para darle a su familia lo necesario para tener una vida digna se dedica a tender un chalet en un hospital, su horario es de lunes a domingo de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema que del dificulte seguir trabajando.
Para incrementar su negocio ella invertirá en la compra de bebidas, golosinas, pan, entre otros productos que le den la oportunidad de fortalecer su negocio, espera tener más clientes satisfechos, aumentar sus ventas y tener una mejor economía con lo que podrá cancelar las cuotas dl crédito y seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para trasladar la mercadería con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Flor, a single mother, lives along with her brother and her children. She runs a snack stall in a hospital in order to give her family the basics to have a dignified life. Her hours are Monday to Sunday from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM. For the moment, she has not had any problems that keep her from continuing to work.

To grow her business, she will invest in the purchase of drinks, snacks, bread, among other products. These will give her the opportunity to strengthen her business. She hopes to have more satisfied customers, increase her sales and have a better economy with which she will be able to pay off the installments of the loan and continue providing for the family's expenses. 

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to move the merchandise more easily.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, bread, among others.

loans.name: Harim Adiel

texts.es: Harim es un joven soltero y sin hijos a cargo, de 20 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica al taller de reparación de bicicletas. Este negocio lo inicio hace pocos año, con el dinero obtenido de su trabajo, el cual era ayudante de un taller. Poco a poco se fue independizando, y hoy en día cuenta con su propio negocio, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante a pesar de ser muy joven, es muy dedicado a su taller. Su meta próxima es seguir extendiendo y mejorando su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas y construir una bodega, con el fin de almacenar todas las herramientas y equipos en esa bodega. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a expandir su negocio, y así lograr a ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en: Harim is a single, 20 year-old young man who does not have children.  He is a native of the city of Esteli.  He has a workshop where he repairs bicycles.  He started this business a short time ago with money he had earned from his job working as an assistant in a workshop.  Gradually he became independent, and today he has his own business.  This has enabled him to get ahead even though he is still very young.  Harim is very devoted to his business.  His next goal is to continue to expand and improve his business.  He is requesting a loan to buy tools and to build a storage unit where he can keep his tools and equipment.  He thinks that this loan will help him to expand his business, so that he can offer better services.  His plans for the future are to continue to improve the infrastructure of his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to build a storage facility for his tools and equipment

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 33 years old and lives in Wedza District, Zimbabwe. 

Purity is dedicated to her community. She is a Community Health development officer passionate about improving the health and well-being of her community. She assists the elderly and vulnerable children with whatever she can spare including food or clothing.  

For the past eight years she has been in the tobacco farming business, which has enabled her to pull through financial hardships.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk, fertilizer, and chemicals. An improvement in her business means she will have the opportunity to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards. 

She will also use the proceeds to pay fees for the orphans and needy children in her community. 
.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with one child, and her child goes to school. She also takes care of her mother. 

She has a business of selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more skirts and blouses. 

She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis four days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

She aspires to own a permanent business premises. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. 

She resides in a rented house, where she has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 23 years old and is married with one child. She currently lives in Hurungwe District where she has been volunteering at schools and in her community as a counselor for the past two years. She is striving to improve the well being of her community. For the past four years she has been in the tobacco farming business. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and she has even managed to employ four people on her farm.
The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk which will reduce shipping costs. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco seeds

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa, 22, is married with two children. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools and teach life skills. 

Over the last three months, Liliosa has grown her poultry business to its current capacity, producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2012, when she finished school. 
 
Poultry production is a successful business in her community. She would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use her Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to raise enough money to continue her education.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Geraldine Dayanna

texts.es: Geraldine es una joven de 19 años estudiante de Geomatica, gracias a sus prestamos ha podido culminar su carrera,este nuevo préstamo lo ha solicitado básicamente para gestionar  su titulación. La motivación mas grande para realizarse como profesional son su padres que siempre la apoyan. Su deseo mas grande es empezar a trabajar y desarrollarse en una empresa de prestigio. Geraldine agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por este préstamo que es de mucha ayuda para ella y otros jóvenes.
texts.en: Geraldine is a young woman of 19 years of age and is a geomatics student. Thanks to her loans she been able to complete her studies, and this new loan she's requesting is basically to have the degree processed. The thing that most motivates her to become a professional is the unwavering support of her parents. Her biggest dream is so start working and growing in a prestigious business. Geraldine thanks the Kiva lenders for these loans that are so helpful to her and other young people.

loans.use: To process her degree

loans.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
La  señora  Juana  de 35 años de edad es casada vive en sus casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace año y medio elaboración de anafres para asar carne y a la venta de barriles de hierro para guardar granos y agua , este producto lo elaboran en su casa con la ayuda de un sobrino, sus ventas son de forma ambulante en diferentes lugares fuera de su municipio.
Doña Juana está muy contenta ya que es un buen negocio donde tiene mucha demanda, es conocida por los amigos y vecinos como una persona muy luchadora.
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de barriles de cartón y  barriles de hierro y con  las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2013
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old and married.
For the past year and a half to making anafres (Honduran appetizer similar to nachos), grilling meat and selling iron barrels that store grain and water.
She makes this product at home with the help of her nephew,  and conducts mobile sales in different locations outside their village.

Juana is very happy because she is in a good business with a lot of demand. She is known by friends and neighbors as a fighter.

Juana is requesting a loan to purchase cardboard barrels and barrels of iron. With her profits and the support of this loan she hopes to succeed and continue to improve her business and better serve her customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to purchase cardboard and iron barrels for her business

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 3. This group is located in a rural area of La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her dream is to have her own house, and thanks to the loan and her savings, she has made it possible to plan it. 

Maritza is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost nine years since starting to sell products. Maritza plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and to finish building her house. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula, tiene la edad de 61 años, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, ella no cuenta con una jubilación digna, por lo que se sustenta de su pequeña venta de frutas y verduras que ha formado con muchos esfuerzos junto a su esposo, para la que solicita el crédito con el objetivo de invertir y le genere ganancias, ingreso con lo que ella mantiene sus gastos.
texts.en: Paula is 61 years old and her children are already grown and independent. She does not have a dignified retirement pension, so she supports herself with her small business selling fruits and vegetables that she started with her husband and a lot of effort. She is asking for the loan for this business with the objective of investing and generating income. She covers her expenses with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy roots, tubers, fruits, vegetables and grains, among other items

loans.name: Juan Paul

texts.es: Don Juan es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de raspado. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de insumos tales como: Mieles y Leche condensada; con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar al por mayor a un menor costo.
texts.en:
Don Juan is originally from the city of Granada. He is a merchant by trade who sells shaved ice. Juan is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito since he will be able to move his business forward.

He is requesting a new loan in order to buy supplies, such as honey and condensed milk. This will enable him to generate better earnings. He believes the loan will be of great help since he will able to purchase in bulk at a lower cost.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as honey and condensed milk.

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es: El señor Ascencio tiene 57 años, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como también venta de leche él vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Ascencio va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado lechero para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  el señor Ascencio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción de leche, el  señor Ascencio es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Sr. Ascencio is 57 years old. He buys and sells livestock, but he also sells milk. Ascencio lives in the town of Batallas. This loan is his first transaction with Emprender. He will use this loan to buy dairy cattle to raise for his business.

His reason for requesting this loan is to improve his earnings. Sra. Ascencio faces challenges in his business, such as making improvements to his venture so that he can improve his quality of life. He will use the profits to buy balanced feed for his cattle so that they can produce more milk.

Sr. Ascencio is a youthful individual who desires to continue forward. He is pleased with the opportunity that has been given to him to improve his business and earn income since this is the only business activity in which he is involved.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Wilson Adolfo

texts.es:
Wilson es un campesino trabajador de 39 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo adolescente de 15 años; a quien ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Lleva 21 años de su vida productiva, trabajando como mayordomo en una finca de la región donde reside y, de manera independiente inició su propio negocio, con el fin de complementar los recursos para llevar el sustento a su hogar; se trata de un cultivo de hortensias que arrendó, el cual era propiedad de su suegro ya fallecido, cuenta con una producción de 12.000 matas y ésta es vendida a una comercializadora internacional; cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado de tiempo completo y actualmente se encuentra tramitando el registro ICA para poder comercializar a otras multinacionales.
Con el crédito que solicita pagará una deuda con un tercero, que tiene pendiente por la construcción de una sala de empaque; esto le permitirá continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y además seguirá avanzando para cumplir su meta de comercializar con otras grandes empresas; generando mayor nivel de ganancias para reinvertir en su oficio y adquirir otro cultivo para diversificar la oferta y así garantizar una estabilidad económica para mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Wilson is an industrious, rural man of 39 years of age. He's married and has a 15-year old teenage son that he has supported with lots of hard work. The start of his work history was 21 years ago as a foreman at a plantation in his area. Afterwards he started his own business with the objective of boosting household finances. The business centers around the growing of hydrangeas that he rented from his now deceased father-in-law, and his production capacity is at 12,000 plants which he sells to an international exporter. He has one full-time employee and is currently registering with ICA so he can sell to other multinational companies. With this loan that's he requesting he will pay off a debt to a third party, which stems from the construction of a packing room. This would allow him to continue his business' growth and additionally get him closer to his goal of marketing to large businesses. That would generate higher income which could then be reinvested in his business to acquire another plant type and diversify his merchandise and guarantee economic stability for the sake of his family's welfare and quality of life.

loans.use: To pay off a debt to a third party, stemming from the construction of a packing room

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Emukaya SHG is a group of 8 group leader farmers in the Kakamega North District with James selected as the Kiva representative. James has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. James is also known as Preacher. Farming inputs will be delivered to him as one of the 62 individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.

James is 66 years old and has been a farmer for 42 years. James works as a farmer to provide for his nine children. The community and other farmers know James as an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community activities such as the men’s group, savings group, and prayer group.
