James described his harvest last year as good, but he hopes to have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

The 2013 Long Rains Season won’t be James’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and he has continued working with One Acre Fund to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds. As an active member in his community, James also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader who wants to help more farmers. James plans on using future profits from the harvest to repair the home, to send children to school, and to save for the future. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training and was able to save money and to feed the family.

James and the Emukaya SHG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 24 years old, married and a mother of one. She lives in Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe. Sylvia is an entrepreneur working with other young women in her rural community, encouraging them to be economically independent. She supports her family by selling fish such as dried kapenta (a small, sardine-like fish) and dried bream in nearby towns. She started her business in 2011 when she started facing financial difficulties and it has enabled her to support her family and provide for their basic needs. 

Sylvia knows there is a high demand for the fish she sells.  With this Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk at fisheries. This will help boost her profits and raise enough money to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de un hijo que vive con ella en su casa hecha a base de madera. Está dedicada a la agricultura. Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de terreno donde posee una buena variedad de cacao orgánico y café; entre otros. Su labor lo desempeña muchas veces con el apoyo de trabajadores para tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y temporada de cosecha esperando culminar las tareas pendientes en un tiempo menor. Al igual que muchos agricultores de su zona trata siempre de mantener en buen estado sus terrenos libres de maleza y fertilizando sus suelo con abono orgánico; entre otros derivados naturales.
Con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida acude a su entidad financiera con el objetivo de obtener un préstamo y concretar la construcción de su vivienda a base de adobe para el cual requiere el apoyo necesario.
Es el primer préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan.
Desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old and the single mother of a son who lives with her in her wooden house.  She is a farmer and has two hectares of land where she has a variety of organic cacao and coffee among other things.  She often works with the help of other workers during complex tasks such as weeding and during the harvests so she can complete the tasks in less time.  Like many other farmers, she tries to maintain her land in good state and free from weeds.  She fertilizes the soil with compost and other natural derivatives.

She wants to improve her quality of life and is asking for a loan to solidify building her house out of adobe, for which she needs help. 

This will be her first loan and she is grateful for the opportunities it provides.  She is asking for 2,000 Neuvos Soles to hire local workers.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de un hijo. De 33 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, por la necesidad de ingresos en su hogar. Decide ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, luego poco a poco fue obteniendo su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio prospero. Su meta próxima es seguir adelante con su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: jabón, shampoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de productos. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá  obtener mejores ventas y buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is from the city of Estelí. She is 33 years old and the married mother of one child. She works as a merchant, dedicating herself to her grocery store business. She started this business a few years ago in order to help support her household. She decided to help her spouse with their expenses, and then gradually began to build her business. She currently has a prosperous business. Her next goal is to continue moving forward with her business.

Sandra is requesting this loan in order to buy soap, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, and candies, among other items. She would like to offer a variety of products. She believes that the loan will be beneficial because she'll be able to make better sales and good profits. Her future plans are to improve the condition of her home and her place of work.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar and candies, among other items.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La señora Griselda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de plásticos y condimentos, desde hace  5 años.
Doña Griselda tiene su negocio en el municipio donde vive y sus ventas son de manera ambulante. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de especias, sal de ajo, comino, achote, canela, etc. y así seguir  realizando sus ventas.
Doña Griselda con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Griselda espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre  del  2013
texts.en:
Griselda is a hardworking and responsible lady who lives in a southern Honduras community with her family.  She sells plastic items and condiments and has done so for five years.  Griselda has her business in the town where she lives and sells on foot.  She needs this loan to buy spices such as garlic salt, cumin, achote, cinnamon, etc. so she can continue making sales.

Griselda hopes that this loan will help increase her sales and that it helps her have the products she needs to cover her customer requests and improve her quality of life with an increase in household income.

Griselda hopes to grow her business in the short term and be able to continue supporting her family and for her children to have the necessary education so they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – December 2013

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Shandirai

texts.en:
Shandirai is a 19-year-old single young woman living in Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Learner Guide in schools, teaching students life skills as a part of their education. The Learner Guides program is run by Camfed and supports children’s learning and academic acheivement. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (maize flour), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. Shandirai inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for two years and has managed to employ one person during that time. 

Shandirai intends to use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her supplies. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Progress

texts.en:
Progress is a 29-year-old mother of two. She lives in Wedza District in Zimbabwe and volunteers at the local school where she helps to restore dilapidated buildings. She currently operates a food takeaway service where she cooks for the community. She offers a menu which includes sadza (cornmeal), rice, beef, vegetables, chicken, fish, and chips. After finishing school in 2012, Progress was inspired to start the business after talking with her friend who is now one of her suppliers.

The loan offers her an opportunity to relocate and improve her business. She intends to use the loan to rent a stall at the local food court, which will be more hygienic, and to purchase more ingredients for her dishes. An improvement in the business would mean more customers. She will use the proceeds to support herself and continue her education.

loans.use: To move her business to new premises

loans.name: Nothando

texts.en:
Nothando is 23 years old and lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. Nothando runs a general store where she sell various products such as chemicals, electrical gadgets, farming equipment, adaptors, stoves, antibiotics for livestock,  chick feed, maps, and brooms.  

She started her business in 2012 and it has enabled her to provide for her family. With a Kiva loan, Nothando intends to expand the number of supplies in her store and hopes to secure a stable source of income to sustain her family and to make sure that her siblings complete school because she appreciates the value of education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Obidzhon

texts.ru: Обиджон родился в 1970 году. Он трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный человек. Обиджон 20 лет назад начал свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он знает хорошо все тонкости своего дело. Обиджон выращивает зерновые культуры и овощи. В этом году он не смог получить намеченный урожай. Он получил маленький доход. Обиджон не имеет денег, чтобы купить угля. Он должен купить уголь, так как зимой очень холодно. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки угля. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Obidzhon was born in 1970 and is a hardworking, cheerful person. He started a business raising crops twenty years ago and knows his trade well. He plants grains and vegetables, but his crops did not do as well as expected this year. He earned a small income and has no money to buy coal, which needs because the winter is very cold. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy coal. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy coal for his family for the winter season

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Andrelene is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 5. This group is located in a rural area of La Romana. She lives in a simple home structure in one of the rural areas near the town of Romana. She says that her dream is to have her own house and her family.

Andrelene is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost four years, selling products. Andrelene plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear to sell. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and save for her coming future. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 26-year-old single young woman living in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Cama Community Health Trainer and an entrepreneur.  She started her poultry business in 2011 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens with lean meat. She currently produces about 200 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Melody knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks, chick feed, and organic manure to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two children and keep them in school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed

loans.name: Vivinus

texts.en:
Vivinus is a 21-year-old single mother of one living in Wedza District of Zimbabwe. Vivinus is an enthusiastic volunteer in her community who helps mentor young women in entrepreneurship.  She has been running businesses for eight months now. From her rented stall in the local village, she sells shirts, shorts, and lady’s tops, as well as shoes. 

With this Kiva loan, Vivinus plans to expand the size and range of merchandise to expand her business and increase profits. She hopes to open her own shop and use the additional income to help her support her child by paying for her school fees

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her stall

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and married, with four children. She is an active community volunteer who organizes and participates in various activities such as washing school sport uniforms and conducting counseling session with orphans and vulnerable children. She is currently running a hardware store selling products such as bicycle parts, electrical plugs and sockets, and machetes. During the farming season, she also stocks maize and bean seeds to boost her sales. She really loves her business and would like to improve it any way she can. 

She will use the loan to purchase more hardware equipment such as bicycle parts, electrical plugs, and sockets. Improving the business means she will be able to provide for herself and her child. An investment in Mary’s business will work to break the cycle of poverty for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with six children and three of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells used clothes on a retail basis at the market. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has been in this business for eleven years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 31-years-old and lives in the Wedza District. She is a Community Health Development officer working to improve the health and well-being of her community. She started in the tobacco farming business when her husband got a plot of land in 2009. Over the course of her four years of operation, Getrude has managed to employ two people on her plot.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase farming equipment and chemicals. An improvement in her business means she will be able to improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and chemicals.

loans.name: Servina

texts.en:
Servina is a 25-year-old single, young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs so they can become more financially independent.  She started her poultry business in 2011 after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers. To date she has managed to employ one person.

With this Kiva loan, Servina will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: La Unidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Justa is the group coordinator for La Unidad 1 (The United). This group is composed of five women entrepreneurs. Justa lives in a rural area near the city of Hato Mayor (a city surrounded by rural areas) because of her agricultural activities. She is a single mother with five children.

Justa is receiving her sixth loan and she is very excited. She started her business almost five years ago with her own savings. Justa sells charcoal, fruit, meat, and vegetables at her stand in front of her home. She would like to continue expanding her business by adding more products. She will use this loan to buy charcoal, fruit, vegetables, chicken, and beef. She likes to work and to do business.

Justa will use her business profits to expand her business into a grocery store. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy charcoal, fruit, meat, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Los Excelentes 6 Group

texts.en:
Ramonita is the coordinator of her group, Los Excelentes 6, which is composed of five microentrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is in a rural area outside of the city. Ramonita has a small drugstore where she sells mostly natural medicines and some other products. She and the other members are doing business in their community and nearby ones.

Ramonita is a hardworking mother with three children. Her most important challenge is to work hard to provide for her family and give them as much as as she can: school, clothing, food, etc. She is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional, and she is committed to working harder to improve her business. Ramonita would like to save her profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy natural medicine and other items

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo, tiene 26 años, está casado y vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Mariela de 19 años y sus 2 hijos de 04 y 01 año de edad respectivamente, es por ellos que a diario trabaja arduamente ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gustavo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza ésta actividad desde hace 06 años con ayuda de 02 colaboradores quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados, así puede mantener a su familia tranquila y brindándoles lo que necesita, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es un vendedor muy alegre, que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, además alquila un mototaxi el cual le proporciona un ingreso adicional o en ocasiones el mismo lo maneja por las tardes, al principio le fue muy complicado adaptarse a la rutina porque no conocía bien el negocio, pero con el pasar del tiempo empezó a consolidarse.  En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará  pescados de diferentes especies y de los mejores tamaños para continuar vendiéndolos; por otro lado dará mantenimiento al vehículo que usa en su trabajo comprando algunas piezas y pagando al mecánico que le hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 26 years old, married, and lives with his parents and wife, 19 year old Mariela, and his two children, ages 4 and 1.  He works arduously every day because he wants to provide them with a better quality of life.  Gustavo buys and sells fresh fish and has been doing this for six years with the help of two partners who help with selection, transportation, and sale of the fish.  This way he can keep his family safe and provide them with what they need.  His constant desire for success has brought him into this business and little by little he has become more well-known because he sells the freshest and tastiest fish in the market and he is a very happy vendor who always receives his customers with a smile.  He also rents out a moto-taxi which provides him with an additional income.  Sometimes he drives it himself in the evenings.  At first it was very difficult for him to adapt to the routine, because he didn’t know the business very well, but in time he began to consolidate.

He is asking for a loan of S/ 1,500 and is grateful for the opportunity and trust.  He is also committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the money to buy different fishes in the best sizes to sell.  He also wants to do maintenance on his vehicle by buying some parts and paying a mechanic to do the work.

loans.use: to buy fish and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: 07.03.02 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to resell in the market.

Hương is 51 years old, and she is married with three children.

Hương is the group leader of the 07.03.02 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of four members.
 
Hương lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province; the two other children are grown up.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hương has hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pork to resell in the market.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad de la construcción, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material para concluir una obra, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Juan continues to work in construction.  He says that the previous loan was helpful and he used it to buy materials to complete a job.  Now he is asking for a loan to buy tools.  He is happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow his business and improve his quality of life, since this is the only way he earns a living.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 62 years old and a widow with nine children.

Maura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like milk, spices, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Maura has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling tobacco.

Maura aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like milk, spices, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mila is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mila has been pig fattening for 32 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: 03.01.19 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Dẻo is operating a business selling fruits. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She is 57 years old, and she is married with one child.

Dẻo is the group leader of the 03.01.19 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

Dẻo lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her child is grown up.

In 2012, Dẻo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dẻo has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dẻo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Dẻo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dẻo hopes for her child to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Misma

texts.en:
Misma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Misma has been in this business for eight years. Misma earns more income from raising livestock.

Misma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Morita works hard to support her family.

She has a coffee shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Morita is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase stock like coffee, sugar, milk, etc., for her coffee shop business.

Morita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like coffee, sugar, milk, etc., for her coffee shop

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 57 years old and single with children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct-selling personal products in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock like lotion, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Nena has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct-selling personal collection for two years and also earns an income from peanut vending.

Nena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like lotion, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 50 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Nieves works very hard to provide for them.

Nieves runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, coffee, milk, canned goods, sugar, etc., to sell.

Nieves has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Nieves would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, coffee, milk, canned goods, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Norma is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase materials like thread, fabrics, needles, etc., for her tailoring business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, fabrics, needles, etc., for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ma. Manolita

texts.en:
Ma. Manolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell construction supply business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy more construction supplies to sell at her buy-and-sell construction supply business.

Ma. Manolita has been in this business for 18 years. Ma. Manolita earns more income from her general store.

Ma. Manolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 20 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio para poder ayudarlas, no solo a crecer en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Alguien digno de destacar, es la vida de la señora Emilce, quien es una persona muy sacrificada, ya que se dedica a hacer limpiezas, a través de una empresa, también se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene su pequeña despensa, en la que lucha día a día para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella está constantemente luchando por mejorar y poder crecer.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás, que le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorado. Está contenta por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is in its 20th cycle of the women's communal bank program, where all the women work together and help each other get ahead.  They are also part of the poverty elimination program, which is a way to help them not only with economic but also personal growth.

Emilce's life deserves to be pointed out.  She is a very selfless person who does cleaning work for a company and also has a small shop where she sells foodstuffs.  She works hard every day so she can help her family.  She is constantly striving to improve and be able to grow.  Emilce requests this loan so she can buy supplies for her store, such as beverages, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, etc., which will allow her to continue growing and improving.  She is happy that she and the other women have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy beverages, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois est créé le 15 novembre 2012. Il regroupe les femmes qui habite le même village et qui ont une bonne entente. Elles remboursent toujours leur crédit à temps et sens difficulté. Gaye, celle qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est le représentant du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 filles et un garçon. Madame s'active dans la vente d'habits, de chaussures. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle compte renforcer son capital avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfice tirés de l'activité serviront à payer son mari dans la gestion de la famille en nourriture et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was established on November 15, 2012. It regroups women who get along well and live in the same village. They always repay their loan on time and without problems.

Gaye is the woman raising her hand on the right in the photograph. She's the group's representative. She's married and the mother of six children: five girls and one boy.

Her business consists in selling clothing and shoes. She has a very good experience in this field. She intends to strengthen her working capital with her loan.

Her profits will be used to help her husband cover the family's food expenses and the children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ndioba's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de deux femmes fait partie d'un banc villageois est créé le 28 Août 2009; il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme activités principales l'agriculture, l'élevage et le petit commerce. Thiécka est la représentante; elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée mère de cinq enfants. Elle fait de la culture d'arachide et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle est debout sur la photo à droite et a levé la main.Elle va investir tout son prêt pour acheter des arachides. Le marché est saturé mais la différence par la qualité des produits qu'elle propose fait qu'elle n'a pas de problème. Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne afin de bénéficier d'un prêt plus élevé et aussi avoir son autonomie financière, aider ses enfants dans le domaine de l'éducation
texts.en:
This group of two women is part of a Banc Villageois that was established on August 28, 2009. It is made up of women who live in the same village, and whose main businesses are farming, raising livestock, and retail.

Thiécka, age 51, is the group's representative. She's married and the mother of five children. She grows peanuts and has a good experience in this field. She's the one on the right in the photograph, raising her hand. She will invest all of her loan to buy peanuts

Since the rainy season is over, she buys five sheep for XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 73) each, as well as animal feed. She resells them after six months. The market is saturated, but she stands out thanks to the quality of her products, and she has no difficulties.

With her profits, she intends to bolster her savings in order to obtain a higher loan. She also wants to be financially autonomous, and help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe fait partie d'un banc villageois créé le 28 Août 2009; il est composé de vingt six femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activités principales l'élevage et le petit commerce. Madame Issa la représentante est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est debout sur la photo à droite et a levé la main. Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des assiettes des verres , des pots et des produits alimentaires (riz, huile, sucre,condiments, savons pour renforcer sa boutique qu'elle gère chez elle. Elle va utiliser tout le prêt qu'elle a reçu afin de prétendre des revenus assez consistants car elle est la seule qui fait cette activité dans le village. Avec ses bénéfices,elle participe aux dépenses de la famille et aide aussi son enfant dans sa scolarité tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The group makes up a part of the banc villageois that was established 28 August 2009. It is made up of 26 women who live in the same village. They mostly engage in small-scale commerce and the raising of animals.

Issa, the representative [of the group], is 58 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. She is standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised.

With her loan, she plans to buy plates, glasses, pots, and food products (rice, oil, sugar, condiments, soaps) to support her shop that she runs from her home. She is going to use all the loan that she gets to help her earn a stable income, because she is the only one that does what she does in the village.

With the earnings, Issa is going to help with her family's expenses, support her child's schooling, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food products and other goods

loans.name: Maï's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaire. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Ndoumbé, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 garçon. Sa principale activité est le commerce.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 25 paires de chaussure à 2000 F la paire pour la revendre à 2500 F, 02 rouleaux de 60m de tissu à 5500 F le rouleau revendu à 450 F le mètre, 
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va prendre en charge ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en:
This group of 37 people makes up part of the banc villageois that was established on 22 October 2012. It is made up of members who live in the same area. They all get along and support each other. Their main activity is commerce.

Ndoumbé, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 38 years old. She is married and a mother of two children, one of whom is a boy.

Ndoumbé is a merchant. With this loan, she is going to buy 25 pairs of shoes at 2,000 francs a pair, which she will resell for 2,500 francs a pair; two 60-meter rolls of poplin fabric at 5,500 francs a roll, which she will resell at 450 francs a meter.

With these earnings, Ndoumbé is going to take care of her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy shoes, string, and trimmings

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, la transformation de produits locaux et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mariètou (assise à l’extrême droite de la photo avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 37 ans et mère de quatre garçons et une fille. Elle achète des sacs d’arachide de 50 Kg non décortiqués, fait un tri puis le décorticage pour la revente au marché à un prix plus élevé.

 Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  04 sacs de 50 Kg à 10 000 F CFA l’un pour la revente après décorticage en 22 000 F CFA voir plus.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation de ses  enfants d’une part et d’autre part à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on 17th May 2007 with the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women with experience of the framework of bancs villageois. They all come from the same village and share a strong sense of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main businesses are retail, processing local produce and rain-based agriculture.

Mariètou (sat on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a 37-year-old married mother of four sons and one daughter. She buys 50 kg sacks of shelled peanuts, sorts the peanuts then shells them for resale at market at a higher price.

With this new loan, she plans to buy four 50 kg sacks of shelled peanuts at 10,000 F CFA apiece, which, after being shelled, will be resold for 22,000 F CFA, or an even higher price.

She plans to use the profits in order to support her husband with their children's school fees and to also improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four 50 kg sacks of shelled peanuts at 10,000 F CFA apiece, which, after being shelled, will be resold for 22,000 F CFA, or an even higher price.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 29 juin 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 36 ans et mère de trois enfants : deux garçons et une fille. Son activité consiste à acheter des produits de consommation courante dans les marchés hebdomadaires, tel que des légumes, de l'arachide et condiments de cuisine pour la revente au village, elle fait aussi de la transformation de patte d’arachide.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  10 sacs d’arachide pour 70 000 F CFA en de la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charges des besoins de la famille plus particulièrement dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on 29th June 2008 with the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women with experience of the framework of bancs villageois. They all come from the same village and share a strong sense of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main businesses is retail.

Binta (sat on the far right with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a 36-year-old married mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her business consists of buying popular consumer products at the weekly market then reselling them in the village such as vegetables, peanuts and condiments cooking for resale in the village. She also produces peanut paste.

With this new loan, she plans to buy ten sacks of peanuts for 70,000 F CFA, which will then be processed and resold.

She plans to use the profits in order to support her husband with their family's living expenses, particularly their children's school fees

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of peanuts for 70,000 F CFA, which will then be processed and resold

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2012. Il est composé des membres qui habitent dans la même localité et les environs. Les membres sont solidaire entre eux et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Ramata, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main et âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons. Sa principale activité est le commerce de produits alimentaires. 
Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Son fils doit intégrer l'université et c'est elle qui doit lui venir en aide pour les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
This 26-member group is part of the banc villegeois which was created on 22nd October 2012. Its members all live in the same local area and its surrounding environs. The group has a strong sense of solidarity and they all live together harmoniously. Business is their main source of income. Ramata, the woman on the far-right of the photo with her hand raised, is 50 years old. She is a married mother of three children, all boys. Her main source of income is the buying and selling of food products. 

The profits will be used to pay for the family's expenses. Her son needs to enroll into university and she is the one who must aide him with his tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes etc. to sell

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr:
Mme RACHIDATOU  est mariée sans enfant.
Elle est étudiante  en classe de Licence III à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  03ans. 
Mme veut financer ses études supérieures.
Elle ambitionne être chef d’entreprise et bien s’occuper de sa famille car elle s’est mariée.
texts.en:
Rachidatou is married, with no children. For the past three years, she has been enrolled at ESTPO (Ouagadougou University of Public Works).
Rachidatou wants to finance her higher education studies. Her ambitions are to run a company and to look after her family, as she is now married.

loans.use: to finance her higher education studies

loans.name: Sad 6 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 6 est composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin.  Leur Président s’appelle Adama et on le reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Il évolue dans l’agriculture et le maraichage et a une expérience de plus de 7ans dans cette activité. Il est marié et père de famille. Il prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Il commence sa journée à 6h pour fla terminer à 18. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour commencer à cultiver son périmètre agricole. Ainsi il pourra diversifier sa production et augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The GIE SAD 6 is made up of 10 people who live in the same village and get together as often as required. Their leader is called Adama and has his hand raised in the photo. He has worked in agriculture and market gardening for over 7 years. He is married with children, and looks after his family's everyday needs. He starts his working day at 6am and ends it at 6pm. He is seeking this loan in order to purchase seeds and inputs so that he may begin to cultivate his agricultural area. In this way he will be able to diversify his production and increase his revenues so that he may improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr  ADAMA  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il  est étudiant en classe de licence III  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. 
Mr  veut financer ses études supérieures.
Après les  études, il compte travailler avec les entreprises pour avoir de l’expérience, ensuite créer son propre entreprise.
texts.en: Adama is single without children. For three years, he has been a student in the Level II Professional License program at ESTPO (University of Public Works in Ouagodougou). Adama wants to finance his higher education. After graduation, he plans to work with companies to gain experience. Then he plans to start his own company.

loans.use: to finance his higher education

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr ADAMA est célibataire sans enfant.
Il  est étudiant  en classe de Licence III  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  03ans. 
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Après ses  études, il compte travailler et rembourser le prêt avant de viser d’autres objectifs, fonder une famille et m’occuper de mes parents.
texts.en: Adama is single, and he has no children. For the past three years, he has been enrolled at ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works). Adama wants to finance his higher education studies. Once he completes his studies, he plans to find employment, pay back his loan, and then work towards other goals, such as starting a family and caring for his parents.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies

loans.name: Aminata Mbenque

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est une promotrice  qui habite à coté du guichet. Elle est divorcée et mère de famille. Aminata évolue dans la commercialisation  de divers produits. Elle vend des tissus thioup, du thé, de la crème glace etc...Elle s’approvisionne généralement à Dakar. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h du soir. C’est elle qui gère les charges quotidiennes de sa petite famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son fond de commerce et satisfaire ses clients. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier ses activités afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Madame Aminata  is a promoter who lives near her store. She sells diverse products for a living, from thioup fabrics (waxed fabrics), to tea and ice cream etc. She generally sources her goods from Dakar. She starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 7pm. She is in charge of her small family's needs, as well as her children's school fees. She is seeking this loan in order to boost her working capital and satisfy her customers' needs. In future she would like to diversify her activities in order to boost her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase diverse products, such as tea and fabrics, for re-sale

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois abritant ce groupe a été mise en place le 12 juillet 2008. Il est composé de femmes qui partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont aussi comme objectif commun de faire avancer leur groupement via le programme et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles.

Madame Diouma (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée, âgée de 61 ans et mère de trois garçons. Elle fait de la transformation de patte d’arachide, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années. Elle achète des sacs d’arachide non décortiqués, fait le tri, le décorticage et la transformation pour enfin faire le conditionnement dans des seaux de 5 et 20 Kg.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 20 sacs à 10 500 F CFA le sac pour la transformation et la vente.

Avec des bénéfices moyens de 60 000 F CFA tous les 15 jours, elle pense renforcer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la maison.
texts.en:
This group, part of the Banc Villageois, was formed on the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois (July 12, 2008).  It is made up of (two) women who share the same values of solidarity and mutual assistance.  Their common goal is to develop their group, using microfinance.  Their main activity is small retail business and the processing of agricultural products.

Diouma (raising her hand, on the right-hand side of the photo) is the group's featured borrower.  She is married, 61 years old, and the mother of three sons.  She processes groundnut paste, and has been involved in this activity for several years.  She buys bags of groundnuts, sorts them and removes their hulls, and then processes them and stores them in either 5 or 20 kilo-buckets. 

With her new loan, she is planning to buy 20 bags of groundnuts (each bag costing 10,500 CFA francs), for processing and resale.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs every other week, which will help her to strengthen her savings and to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of groundnuts for processing and resale.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 46 years old. He is married and has two sons and one daughter. His wife is a housekeeper. Elchin is the only person in his family who works. He works in a small market and sells different everyday products, like cookies, butter, milk, sausages,etc. He has run this business for 20 years and has good skills to choose high-quality products when he orders them for his market. His elder son helps him in his business. Elchin’s monthly income is 200 AZN.

Azerbaijani people prefer small markets like the one Elchin has, because they are always located next to one's house, while supermarkets are situated far from some houses and there is only one per district. Moreover, products in small markets are cheaper than in big supermarkets. Elchin borrowed 2000AZN and this is his fifth loan. This money will help Elchin to expand his market business and expand his market's assortment. Moreover, additional income will help to provide his children with education and improve the conditions of his family’s life. He needs it because there is high demand for everyday products among customers and Elchin’s monthly income doesn't allow him expand more. Elchin is a responsible and reliable man and this is his fifth loan.

loans.use: expand his market's assortment

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.en: Asadullo is wonderful man. He was born in 1961. Asadullo is a careful father of six children. Four of them are not yet adults. Asadullo has been busy with growing agricultural products more than 10 years. He has great experience and his experience helps him to develop his business. Asadullo grows wheat in 1.3 ha, corn in 1 ha and watermelons in 1.3 ha. He has a good opportunity for getting water and that’s why his business growing agricultural products is going well and his harvest has a high quality. He is going to prepare a new crop but he has no money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. He is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Nene Galle's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de qui abrite ce groupe a été mise en place le 12 juillet 2008. Il est composé de femmes qui partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont aussi comme objectif commun de faire avancer leur groupement via le programme et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles.

Madame Néné Gallé (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée, âgée de 38 ans et mère de quatre enfants deux garçons et filles. Elle collecte de l’arachide par seaux auprès des villageois pour la revente par sac de 50 Kg, avec une marge bénéficiaire de 25 000 F CFA chaque tourné de 7 jours.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte collecter au moins 25 sacs d’arachide de 50 Kg pour stockage et revente.

Les bénéfices lui serviront en plus d’accroître son épargne, à assister son mari dans les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group, part of the Banc Villageois, was formed on the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois (July 12, 2008). It is made up of women who share the same values of solidarity and mutual assistance, and whose common goal is to develop their group, using microfinance. Their main activity is small retail business and the processing of agricultural products.

Néné Gallé (seated at the far right in the photo, and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 38 years old, and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls).  She gathers buckets of groundnuts from the local villagers, and resells groundnuts in 50-kilo bags, making a profit margin of 25,000 CFA francs every week.

With her new loan, she is planning to fill at least 25 bags of groundnuts (each bag weighing 50 kilos) to be stored and resold. 

She will use her profits to increase her savings, and to help her husband pay for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy at least 25 bags of groundnuts to be stored and resold.

loans.name: Coumba Yero's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois qui abrite ce groupe a été mise en place le 12 juillet 2008. Il est composé de femmes qui partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont aussi comme objectif commun de faire avancer leur groupement via le programme et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles.

Madame Coumba Yéro (assise à droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans, mariée  et mère de  trois enfants dont  deux filles et un garçon. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits de consommation courante : sucre, thé vert, assaisonnement, …. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter : un sac de sucre, un demi-carton de thé vert, deux sachets de «Jumbo», de l’ognon pour une somme globale de 48 000 Frs CFA. 

Les bénéfices nets autour de 6 500 Frs CFA par semaine lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was established on July 12, 2008 during its inauguration. It is comprised of women who share the values of solidarity and helping one another. They also have a common goal of advancing their group through the loan program. They predominantly run small businesses and process agricultural products.

Madame Coumba Yéro (seated at right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children (two girls and one boy). Her business is selling common consumables: sugar, green tea, seasonings, etc. She has been doing this many years. 

Her new loan will allow her to buy one bag of sugar, one half carton of green tea, two packages of "Jumbo," and onions for a total of 48,000 FCFA.

The net profits of around 6,500 FCFA per week will help her support her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: lui permettra d’acheter : un sac de sucre, un demi-carton de thé vert, deux sachets de « Jumbo », de l’ognon pour une somme globale de 48 000 Frs CFA.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Marie Claire est une femme de 36 ans, célibataire et mère de quatre enfants parmi lesquels un va encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et détient un petit restaurant dans un quartier de la cité capitale depuis un ans déjà. Le fait d'acheter les produits de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment pas grand chose et ne lui permet plus de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir chaque jour. C'est pour palier à ce problème qu'elle  sollicite ce crédit. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, sac de riz, casiers de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats). Les bénéfices qui en résulteront seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Claire is 36 years old, single, and a mother of four children, of whom one still goes to school. 

Marie Claire is a merchant and has had a small restaurant in the capital for one year already. Buying goods for her restaurant at retail does not work well and does not allow her to satisfy her customers, who continue to grow in number each day. To solve this problem, Marie Claire requested this loan.

This loan will allow her to increase her stock of foodstuffs (sacs of groundnuts and rice, cases of fish, meat, vegetables, and other small necessities to cook her meals). 

Earnings will be partly reinvested in the business to help it expand. The rest will allow her to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Batumi district, west Georgia. She has a son, daughter-in-law and little grandson. Her daughter-in-law works as a cooker at the wedding hall and earns 350 GEL monthly. On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Meri works in her own business selling fruits and vegetables from the counter. She works every day for about 10 hours and thinks she does well because of her good prices and the kind way she treats others.
Meri is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy a greater amount and variety of fruits and vegetables so that her business will be better stocked and she can take care of more customers and continue working and striving to reach her greatest dream: more economic stability and increasing the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount and variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Goris where she lives with her husband. Naira has been selling flowers in Goris town for many years. From a small rented store in the center of the town, Naira provides beautiful and fresh flowers to locals every day. She works hard to provide high quality service and her clients value the work that she does. Naira now needs financial support to be able to purchase new flower seeds and flowers to sell. Because of many costs, she isn't able to do it by herself and that's the reason she asks for this loan. 

Naira has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Naira's further work and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new flower seeds and flowers for selling to customers

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business where she manufactures brooms in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Nelia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like bamboo, rope, abaca (a plant fiber), etc. for her broom making business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like bamboo, rope, abaca, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ramzija

texts.en:
Ramzija is twenty-three years old, married, and a mother of two girls, ages two and five years old, living in an Ashkali community. She is a housewife, and her husband is the sole income for the family. He works hard to support the needs of his family by working in construction, doing private freelance, and delivering furniture to customers for a furniture company. 

Ramzija is requesting a loan in order to purchase some tools for the construction work her husband does. She believes that this loan will help him work much faster, be more efficient, and increase the scope of the work he is able to complete as he will be able to work on larger projects.

The goal is to expand her husband’s business and acquire more clients in order to save the money for the family’s future. Ramzija appreciates the support from all Kiva's lenders!

loans.use: To purchase tools for the construction work that her husband does

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is a Cameroonian aged forty-one. She is married with six children; the oldest is nineteen and in high school while the youngest is eight and in primary school. She has been in this business for over two years which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her turnover by fifty percent and her profit by 29 percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy communication credit to resell.

loans.name: His Majesty Group

texts.en:
This Group is made up of four ladies who live in the same area  and are part of the group called His Majesty. They all sell groceries (rice, milk, sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks), food stuff, fish, meat, plastic bowls, shampoo, wigs, etc.

Vida, who is 56 years, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running a grocery shop for 20 years. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Vida's 9th loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase the grocery stock (rice, milk, sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks) and has repaid back all her loans successfully. She used her profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. 

Vida will share this loan with her loan group "His Majesty Group," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of GHS 4100.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three ladies who live in the same area and are part of the group called Biakoye. They are into the sale of ladies slippers, vegetables and groceries (rice, milk, sugar, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks).

Sarah is 37 years old and single with two children who are still in school. She has been selling ladies slippers for 10 years. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Sarah's fifth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase her slippers business and has repaid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more slippers to sell to customers. 

Sarah will share this loan with her loan group, Biakoye Group, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of 2,300 GHS.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: God Is Good 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five persons who live in the same area and are part of the group called God is Good 2. They are into the sale of jewelry, fuel pumps, jeans, polo shirts, dippers and wigs. 

Safiatu, 38 years old, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been operating a jewelry shop for four years. She works from 7 AM to 10 PM daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Safiatu's fourth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to increase the jewelry business and has repaid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more jewelry to sell to customers. 

Safiatu will share this loan with her loan group (God is Good 2 Group), which has five members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan amount of GHS 3,900.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hannah's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hannah's Group and has been with ID Ghana for six years. The group is made up of women who have a lot of experience in their various businesses. The women all come from the same neighborhood and have very strong ties as a result of working together and helping one another. 
This will be Charity's Group’s seventh loan. The group is applying for a 5,500 GHS loan which will be apportioned among the group members. The proceeds will be used by them to buy and sell clothing, slippers, pomade perfume, bags of millet and rice, and underwear.
The group’s loan representative is Hannah, who is thirty years old, married and the mother of two children. For the past seven years she has sold clothing and slippers which she buys from the central market at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail in Dansoman. She will use her earnings to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses and needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy clothing and slippers and resale to customers in Dansoman.

loans.name: Elizabeth Group

texts.en:
Please meet members of the “Elizabeth" group from Dansoman, a fast growing business area in Accra, Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 1,500 to supplement their capital. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. The 43-year-old is married to a mechanic and they have two children.
 
Elizabeth has been a businesswoman for 14 years now. She sells rice and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of rice and vegetables to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of rice and vegetables to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Человек с прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последнее время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут Голибчон.  Ему 33 года, женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 5 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он откармливает крупно-рогатый скот. Голибчон продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить свою семью хорошим условием проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A person with a beautiful soul, who lives in the high Tajikistan mountains, needs your support because lately he has had trouble with his finances.  His name is Golibjon.  He is 33 years old, married and raising one son.  The climate in his locale is quite favorable for growing agricultural crops and also for animal husbandry.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years.  He fattens up cattle.  Golibjon sells livestock after he looks after it for several months.  He has many clients at the market.  He wants to develop his business, but does not have enough money for it.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy livestock in order to develop his business.  He plans to provide his family with good living conditions with the resulting income.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to develop his business

loans.name: Rosula

texts.en:
Rosula is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bags in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bags to sell to her customers for her business.

Rosula has been in this business for one year. Rosula earns more income from a general store.

Rosula has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aileen is 25 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Aileen has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for two years. Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. Anabelle is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Anabelle requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 10 years now.
 
In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is 26 years old and married with two children. Baby Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Baby Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Baby Jane has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. 

Baby Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bibikhol

texts.ru:
Бибихолу 45 лет. Она с двумя детьми живет в городке Нурек. Бибихол разведена с мужем и детей растет сама. Ее дети учатся в школе. Она надеется, что сможет вырастить и поставить на ноги своих детей. 
  Бибихол имеет магазин, где сама занимается продажей продуктов питания. Она берет кредит для увеличения товара в магазине. С каждым годом ее деятельность увеличивается, в том числе количество постоянных клиентов и доход. Бибихол очень рада, что имеет клиентов, которые уже заказывают продуктов по телефону. Скоро зима и привозить товар будут сложнее. Бибихол хочет на сумму кредита приобрести новые продукты и пополнить свои старые запасы.
texts.en: Bibikhol is 45 years old.  She and her children live in the city of Nurek.  Bibikhol is divorced and raising the children by herself.  Her children attend a school.  She hopes that she will be able to raise and get her children on their feet.  Bibikhol has a store, where she is involved in selling food products.  She is requesting a loan to increase the number of goods in her store.  Each year her business grows, including the number of regular clients and income.  Bibikhol is very happy that she has clients who are already ordering products by phone.  Winter is coming soon, and it will be harder to bring in merchandise.  Bibikhol wants to use this loan to buy new products and refill her old inventories.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover and refill product inventory

loans.name: Cristiam Denniz

texts.es: El joven Cristiam tiene 31 años y es Soltero,  estudia la carrera  técnica en uno de los muchos institutos técnicos de  la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Cristiam trabaja en la venta de Dvds tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en  la Zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y Cristiam va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo financiar los gastos escolares de matriculación, Materiales y/o útiles para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 3 años. Cristiam enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse al 100% a su estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante. su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Young Cristiam is 31 years old and single.  He is pursuing a technical degree at one of the many technical institutes in the city of La Paz.  He works to pay for his classes.  Young Cristiam works selling DVDs.  He has a stand in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto.  This is his first loan with the Institution and Cristiam is going to use this loan for different school expenses, such as paying his tuition fees and buying materials and/or tools to finish his studies, which will take three years.  Cristiam faces challenges in his studies, such as his work, which prevents him from dedicating himself 100% to his studies, but this young man wants to keep going and get ahead.  When he finishes his studies he wants to practice his profession and improve his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to cover his school expenses, such as tuition, materials and/or tools, etc.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура уже второй раз кредитуется. Первый кредит она брала для начала нового бизнеса животноводства. Теперь она просить кредит для развития бизнеса и увеличения поголовья скота. У Мастуры большая семья, состоящая из его мамы, братьев, племянников и своих детей. После развода Мастура переехала в родительский дом и ее и детей кормила семья. Она открыла свой бизнес, чтобы быть не зависимой, поставить на ноги своих детей и принести пользу в семейный бюджет. Мастура просит помочь поддержать новый бизнес. Она верит и надеется, что ей обязательно помогут.
texts.en: Mastura is obtaining a loan for the second time.  She obtained her first loan to start a new business in animal husbandry.  Now she is requesting a loan to develop her business and increase livestock headcount.  Mastura has a large family - her mother, brothers, nephews and her children.  After her divorce, Mastura moved to her parents' home, and her family supported her children.  She opened her business to be independent, to get her children on their feet and bring a benefit to the family budget.  Mastura is asking for help to support her new business.  She believes and hopes that she will certainly be helped.

loans.use: to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Pioneras” está conformado por 06 socias responsables y dinámicas. Este es el caso de Hirma de 58 años casada con 03 hijos 01 de ellos en etapa escolar.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Se siente feliz pues a pesar de las competencias Hirma ha llegado fidelizar a sus clientes. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la compra de golosinas  y bebidas. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Las Pioneras” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Hirma se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo celeste y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
The "Las Pioneras" group has six responsible and dynamic members. One of these members is Hirma, who is 58 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. Hirma makes a living selling basic, staple goods. She feels happy in spite of the competition she has. Hirma has managed to gain loyalty from her customers. This loan will be used to brink sweets and drinks. Hirma's biggest wish is to continue implementing her business plan.

The "Las Pioneras" group is thankful for this loan and promises to continue working hard. In the photo, Hirma is standing up - she is on the right, wearing a light blue t-shirt and black trousers.

loans.use: to buy sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Los Izquchaquinos Group

texts.es:
FRESEA TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD, PERTENECE AL GRUPO LOS IZCUCHAQUINOS.
ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA, SU NIÑO TIENE 11 AÑOS, Y ESTUDIA EN UNA ESCUELA DE SU LOCALIDAD.
FRESEA VIVE CON SUS PADRES, CON QUIENES ELABORA SUS PRODUCTOS; ELLA SE SIENTE ORGULLOSA DE SUS PADRES POR QUE SIEMPRE FUERON EMPRENDEDORES.
FRESEA EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR LUEGO DE TERMINAR EL COLEGIO, YA QUE TUVO A SU HIJO MUY JOVENCITA.
ELLA VENDE EN LA PLAZA PRINCIPAL DE SU LOCALIDAD LOS PRODUCTOS QUE ELLA MISMA ELABORA, COMO PANES, RELLENOS, EMPANADAS, PANECILLLOS ESPECIALES; QUE LOS OFRECE A DIARIO DESDE LAS 4 DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS 6 DE LA TARDE.
EL SUEÑO QUE FRESEA TIENE ES EL DE QUE SU HIJO SEA UN PROFESIONAL Y EL DE TENER SU PROPIA PANADERÍA Y DARLE TRABAJO A LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD.
ELLA ESTA TOTALMENTE AGRADECIDA, POR EL SACRIFICIO QUE HACEN CON APOYARLOS PARA LOGRAR SUS SUEÑOS.
FRESEA VISTE UN POLO COLOR FUCSIA, Y ES LA TERCERA DE LA DERECHA 

(LA SEÑORITA QUE VISTE CON CASACA PLOMA Y TIENE UNA BOLSA ROJA, ES LA ESPOSA DEL SR. LEONIDAS)
texts.en:
Fresea is 25 years old and is part of the "Izcuchaquinos" group.

Fresea is a single mother to an 11-year-old boy - he is studying at a local school.

Fresea lives with her parents, with whom she works, making her products. She feels very proud of her parents because they were always very enterprising.

Fresea started working after leaving school as she had her son at a very young age. In the main square of her town, Fresea goes out to sell products, such as bread and pastries, that she herself has made. She sells these products from 4am until 6pm.

Fresea's dream is for her son to have a profession and, for herself, to own her own bakery and give other local people week.

Fresea is very grateful for the sacrifice you are making to support her with her dreams.

In the photo, Fresea is third on the right, wearing a purple top.

(The young woman in the grey top and with a red bag is Leonidas' wife).

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter and more.

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
