She has a tobacco-vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from food-vending. Cristina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 20 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dulce has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Dulce has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Panfila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional gear and tools for her fishing business.

Panfila has been in this business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gear and tools for her fishing business.

loans.name: Guerison Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kabuo est une commerçante d’une expérience de 20 ans, âgée de 59 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Guérison ». Elle est vendeuse de viande/vache (Boucherie). Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 quartiers de viande. Son conjoint est vendeur d’eau dans les périphéries de la ville (Borne fontaine). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir tous ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kabuo, is a merchant with twenty years of experience. She is 59 years old and a mother of eight children, all students. She is a member of a business association "Guérison". Her husband is a water vendor in the outskirts of the city (Borne Fontaine). Kabuo is a vendor of meat/cattle (butcher). She started her business with funds from her husband and is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She is going to purchase 2 quarters of meat. For the future, Kabuo would like to build her own house, provide education to her children, and feed them. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans during this time of conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mwaka est une commerçante depuis 10 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Chance », âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient  et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse de braise et de farine de manioc. Elle étale ses activités dans un dépôt du marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 10 sacs de braise et 5 sacs de manioc.  Son conjoint est un militaire de l’armée loyaliste. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de sa maman. Dans l’avenir, elle compte faire l’élevage pour sa famille, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il seid de signaler quelques clientes portent leurs bebes.
texts.en:
This client, Mwaka, has been a merchant for ten years and a  member of a business association "Chance". She is 32 years old and a mother of four children, of whom two are students and two others are still very young. Her husband is a soldier in the loyalist army. Mwaka is a vendor of charcoal  and cassava flour. She started her business with funds from her mother. She is setting up her business in a warehouse at the city market and is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She is going to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and 5 sacks of cassava. 

For the future, Mwaka plans on raising livestock. For her family and children, she plans on providing education, clothing, and food. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans during this time of conflict in the country's east. It should be noted that a few of the clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and cassava

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, una campesina de 58 años de edad, ha realizado labores agrícolas desde que era pequeña, pues era el estilo de vida de su familia, quienes trabajaban en el campo para conseguir el sustento diario; gracias a ello, hoy en día posee su propia finca en la que tiene cultivos de diferentes productos, especialmente de aguacate cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside. Siempre encuentra la manera de salir adelante, a pesar de los desafíos y las dificultades que se presentan por los cambios climáticos que dañan su cultivo y por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas requeridos.
Sin embargo, Luz sigue adelante y esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios al por mayor (fertilizantes, pesticidas, abonos) y más palos de aguacate injerto; esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y además podrá continuar con el cuidado de los cultivos, para sacar mayor provecho en las cosechas y poder ofrecer más cantidad de alimentos en el mercado.
Luz manifiesta que su propósito es seguir trabajando en su finca y hacer que cada día sus cosechas sean más productivas para garantizar una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica con la que su esposo, sus 5 hijos y ella puedan disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is from the country.  She is 58 years old and has been farming since she was little because this was her family’s way of life and they worked on the fields to earn a living.  Thanks to this, she has her own farm where she raises different products, especially avocados, and sells the harvest in her local market.  She always finds a way to get ahead, despite the challenges and difficulties that present themselves due to climate changes that damage her crops and because of the high cost of required supplies.

However, Luz continues to move forward and she is asking for a loan to buy the supplies she needs in quantity (fertilizers, pesticides, compost) and more avocado trees.  This will allow her to increase her production and she will be able to continue caring for her crops and increase her harvests so she can bring more food into the marketplace.

Luz says that her purpose is to continue working on her farm and make her harvest more productive and profitable so she, her husband, and five children can have better living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans, Sylvain est revendeur des accessoires de voitures. Il est aussi électricien auto depuis 2008 et exerce son activité dans un garage. Son premier crédit lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. Il espère devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard un foyer.
texts.en: A young man, 27 years old, Sylvain is retailer of automobile accessories. He has also been an automotive electrician since 2008 and operates his business in a garage. His first loan will be used to purchase more merchandise in order to satisfy his customers. He hopes to become a wholesale merchant and start a family later on.

loans.use: to purchase automobile equipment and accessories

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi vit avec son mari chauffeur et ses 03 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle revend de la nourriture dans une boutique et achète ses ingrédients au Grand Marché de Lomé. Manquant de fonds pour s'approvisionner , elle fait sa toute première demande à WAGES. Elle souhaite assurer un avenir radieux à la famille et agrandir son activité. Âgée de 35ans, elle a une ancienneté de 19ans dans l'activité.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 35 years old and lives with her husband, who is a driver, and their three children, who all attend school in Lomé.  

In order to really help her husband with the expenses of their family, Akouvi sells food from a small shop.  She has nineteen years' experience in her business.  

Akouvi buys her provisions at the main market in Lomé.  However, she does not have enough money to buy the supplies that she needs, so she has requested this, first, loan from the field partner, WAGES.  She will use her earnings to expand her business and ensure a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 42-year-old, hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three sons. 

Her husband is a carpenter by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past two years, in addition to the profession of carpenter, he also drives rickshaw at night. Currently, he is not able to generate any income from the rickshaw because its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to pay for repairing the engine of her husband's rickshaw. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new mobile shop for his elder son, in the future. 

Kousar desires to provide quality education to her all children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La Señorita Aurelia tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de técnico superior en belleza y cosmetologia en uno de los institutos técnicos muy reconocidos de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Aurelia trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja alquilando sillas y mesas para distintos acontecimientos sociales,  la Señorita Aurelia va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como o pago de matrícula,  compra de material para sus estudios para sus estudios que durara el tiempo tres años,  la Señorita Aurelia enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Huayna Potosi, su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 20 years old and single.  She is studying for a degree in beauty and cosmetology at one of the well known technical institutes in the city of La Paz. Aurelia has worked to pay for her studies by renting chairs and tables for different social events.  

She plans to use this loan for the costs of studying such as the matriculation fee and materials needed for her studies, which will take three years.  Aurelia encounters challenges with her studies, which include a lack of financial support from her parents and needing to work and study, which is very difficult.  She hopes to continue forward and succeed in finishing her degree so that she can work in her profession.  She lives in the area of Huayna Potosi.  Her dream is to finish her studies and be able to find work in her profession, and in time be able to study for a masters.

loans.use: to pay matriculation fees and purchase supplies for her studies.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru:
Комилчон около 15 лет предоставляет услуги по перевозки больших грузов. Его машина долгое время ему служила. Для Комилчона машина не только средство передвижения, но и друг и источник дохода в семью. 
   Комилчон женатый мужчина. Он отец четверых детей. Его старшей дочери 6 лет, а младшей 2 годика. Самому Камилчону 49 лет. Комилчон чувствует свою ответственность перед собой и своей семьей. Он старается беречь их и обеспечить едой, жильем, образованием и здоровьем. 
   Машина Комилчона служила ему долгое время и срочно нуждается в ремонте. Запчасти грузовых машин стоят очень дорого, и у Комилчона не хватает средств, чтобы приобрести необходимые части машины, и он просит кредит. Предоставление услуги по перевозке грузов приносит в семью Комилчона достаточный доход. Комилчон своей работой обеспечивает свою семью и своих животных. Для него это работа очень важная и он очень нуждается в финансирование. Помогите Комильчону купить автозапчасти для грузовой машины, чтобы не потерять работу.
texts.en:
Komilchon has been driving a rig for about 15 years. His truck has served him for a long time. To Komilchon, his truck is not only a means for survival, but also a friend and a breadwinner for the family. Komilchon is 49, married, and is the father of four children. His oldest daughter is 6, and the youngest is 2. Komilchon has a strong sense of responsibility, both personally, and for his family. He is trying to take care of his family and provide it with food, a home, education, and medical care.

Komilchon’s truck has served him a many years, but now is in immediate need of repair. Spare parts for trucks are very expensive, and Komilchon cannot afford what he needs. So he is asking for a loan. Driving a truck brings in enough income for Komilchon’s family; to supports both the family and their animals. So Komilchon’s job is very important and he needs some financial assistance. Help Komilchon buy spare parts for his truck so that he does not lose his job.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Ulda Maria

texts.es: Ulda María, es  una humilde madre de dos hijos de 14 y 16 años quienes asisten a la escuela secundaria, ella es comerciante de frutas y verduras, como responsable de familia intenta salir adelante con este negocio para la manutención de sus hijos. Con el crédito que solicita comprara legumbre, papas, cebollas, chiltomas, zanahorias, chayotes frutas como sandias, banano, piña, naranjas entre otros, con esta inversión mantener las ventas para continuar recibiendo ingresos.
texts.en:
Ulda María is a humble mother of two children who are 14 and 16 years old and attend high school.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  Since she is responsible for her family, she wants to move forward with this business to support her children.

With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase vegetables, potatoes, onions, chiltomas (a sweet pepper), carrots, chayotes, and fruits such as watermelon, bananas, pineapples, oranges, and others.  With this investment, she will maintain her sales to continue earning income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, onions, chiltomas, carrots, and chayote, and fruits such as watermelon, banana, pineapple, and oranges.

loans.name: Maria Lisseth

texts.es: Doña María Lisseth tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, dos de ellos independientes y los otros trabajan junto a su madre en diferentes actividades como sastrería, reposterías, venta de ropa usada y un poco de medicamentos, para salir adelante se involucran todos para lograr vender y obtener ingresos para la manutención de la familia, siendo doña María Lisseth madre soltera viene luchando por dejarle un buen porvenir a sus hijo. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando telas, medicamentos y ropa usada, siendo estos los mas comercializados.
texts.en:
María Lisseth is 38 years old.  She has four children, two are independent and the others work together with her in different activities such as tailoring, pastry-making, and used clothing and some medicine sales.  In order to move forward, they all work together to make sales and earn income to support the family. María Lisseth is a single mother who is fighting to give her children a better future.  

She is currently requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing fabrics, medicines, and used clothing, since these are the most in demand products.

loans.use: to purchase and invest in fabrics, medicines, and used clothing.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Asteria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

Asteria has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Bafundi est une commerçante depuis 4 ans, junior entrepreneur est membre d’une Association d’Affaires  « Alliance», âgée de 20 ans et mère d’ 1 enfant qui est encore bambin. Elle est vendeuse de farine de manioc. Elle étale ses activités dans un marché de la ville.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 sacs  de manioc. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle commença ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre ses activités, préparer l’avenir pour le mieux être, vêtir et nourrir son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Bafundi has been a trader for four years.  She is a junior entrepreneur, and a member of the business association 'Alliance'.  Bafundi is twenty years old, and mother to one child, who is still a baby.

Bafundi sells cassava flour at a market in town.  She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She will use her loan to buy two sacks of cassava.

Bafundi's husband is also a retailer, and she started her business with funds provided by him.

In the future, Bafundi would like to expand her business, prepare for the future to ensure a better standard of living, clothe and feed her child.

Bafundi would like to thank Hekima for the support and loans which they provide to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, during this time of conflict in the east of the country.

It should be noted that one of the entrepreneurs is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of cassava for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Mariée à un maçon carreleur et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, madame Kokoé revend des produits d'alimentation générale au marché. Elle fait son troisième prêt pour acheter des marchandises et espère entretenir sa famille et augmenter le chiffre d'affaire de son activité avec le profit tiré de la vente. Elle a démarré en 2000 et âgée de 40ans.
texts.en:
Kokoé is forty years old.  She is married to a mason/tiler, and they have three children.  Two of their children attend school.

Kokoé sells general food products at the market.  She started her business in 2000.

This will be her third loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy stock for resale.  In this way, she hopes to increase her business earnings, and she will use this money to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima and her husband, Jagadish, live in a small town Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They have two children. One is studying in class V (grade 5) and the other one is studying in class VI (grade 6). Pratima has read up to class VI (grade 6) and her husband is illiterate but knows how to sign his name.

Her husband is working as a daily labourer and she is running her saree business. She sells sarees (Indian women's dresses) door to door, but she does not have enough income from her business to run her family because she does not have sufficient stocks. 

To build good stocks she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that her selling can increase. She is experienced in the saree business and this business has good demand in her locality. With this loan amount she will buy varieties of sarees. 

She wants to give higher education to her children after earning good profit from this business and hopes it can make her family’s financial condition smooth. Her future dream is to open a saree shop from the profit. She is very happy to become a member of BJS and thankful to Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase varieties of sarees for selling.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 48-year-old housewife who lives with her husband in West Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri.  They have two children (one son, one daughter).  Both the children are students and reading in grade 12 and grade 10.  Purnima and her husband both are illiterate and know how to sign their names but both are very ambitious to give a good education and a bright future to their children.

Purnima is a homemaker while her husband is a farmer. They have their own land where her husband cultivates different vegetables and supplies them to the market, but his income is not sufficient to raise their children to lead a proper life in this expensive era.

Now, Purnima plans to take a loan from BJS to invest in potato cultivation. Though there are some risks in cultivating potatoes, she still prefers to use more farmland for this business because potatoes are in great demand in her area as well as a popular vegetable used in most of the Indian dishes.

She hopes to give proper education to her children, upgrade their lifestyle and purchase land for expanding their farm.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for the loan that can make her dreams true.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for starting cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 25-year-old, hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. 

Shakeela's husband is an electrician, by profession. He runs an electronics shop in his village, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, he decided to shift his shop to the central bazaar. 

Due to a lack of funding, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to fund the cost of shifting her husband's shop to the central bazaar. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new electronics shop in the future. 

Shakeela desires to provide quality education to all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for moving her husband's electronics shop to the central bazaar.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Couturière depuis 2011, Akossiwa revend aussi des tissus et des articles de mercerie. Vue que son stock s'épuise, elle fait sa première demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer ses besoins. Elle est âgée de 36ans.
texts.en: A seamstress since 2001, Akossiwa also resells notions. Since her stock is running out, she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy supplies and meet customer demand. She hopes to expand her business and provide for her needs. She's 36 years old.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions

loans.name: Gie Madar Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Madar comme son nom l’indique, regroupe cinq femmes qui travaillent dans la fabrication de savon liquide appelé « madar ». Le produit fini sera commercialisé dans le marché. Le GIE est nait depuis maintenant huit ans. Les membres ont suivi une formation sur comment fabriquer ce produit et on pensé à s’associer pour former un groupe d’intérêt économique, en fabriquer pour revendre et avoir un fond qui pourra servir à diversifier les activités du groupe.
Le groupe est dirigé par la dame Ndèye Codou, qui apparait sur la photo comme étant au milieu. Connue pour son dynamisme, malgré sa taille, sa devise d’aller toujours de l’avant. Elle coordonne toutes les activités du GIE. Elle est mariée et mère de famille très participative à la gestion de son foyer : elle s’occupe de la scolarisation de ses enfants et des besoins quotidiens de ces derniers.
 Elle désire amener le GIE à un niveau élevé avec un outillage plus sophistiqués, une renommée positive et un marché régulier pour l’écoulement du produit.
texts.en:
GIE Madar is made up of five women who make a liquid soap called "madar". The end product will be sold at the market. The groups was established eight years ago. 

The group's members underwent training on how to make this product, and decided to get together and establish a GIE ("groupe d'intérêt économique, i.e. economic interest group).

They make soap and sell it in order to have funds that could be used to diversify the group's activities.

The group is run by Mrs. Ndèye Codou. She's the women in the center in the photograph. Know for her energy in spite of her height, her motto is : always go forward. She coordinates all the group's activities.

She's married and the mother of a family, and she's very much involved in running the household : she takes care of the children's education, and provides for their daily needs.

She wishes to take the group to a higher level, with more sophisticated tools, a positive reputation, and a regular market to move inventory.

loans.use: to make and sell a liquid soap called "madar"

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marebec

texts.en:
Marebec is 37 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Marebec requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marebec has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ange est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «La promesse », entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans  et mère de 6 enfants qui 2 étudient et 4 autres passent journée à la maison. La cliente est une vendeuse de farine de maïs. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un  dépôt du marché de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 15 sacs de farine de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite  construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler q'une cliente est avec son bébé.
texts.en:
Ange is a retail entrepreneur, and member of the business group 'La Promesse' (The Promise).  She is 48 years old and mother to six children.  Two of her children attend school and the other four spend the day at home.

Ange has been selling maize flour from a depot at the local market for eight years.  She began her business with an investment made by her husband, who is also a retailer.  Later, she started working with the field partner, Hekima.  She will use her loan to buy fifteen sacks of maize flour and will use her earnings to build a house, educate and feed her children.

Ange warmly thanks Hekima for helping non-bankable, women entrepreneurs to become independent during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

It should be noted that one of the entrepreneurs has her child with her.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of maize flour for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 37-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and three sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2008, her husband has had a vegetable shop, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. 

He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Irshad, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a greater variety of vegetables and fruits for his vegetable shop, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Irshad and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables for the shop.

loans.name: Bibien

texts.fr: Bibien est une femme de 44 ans séparée, mère de 4 enfants. Elle gère un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 10 ans déjà où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et de la nourriture. Elle a acquise au fil du temps une expérience dans le domaine ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable. Malheureusement, la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement la demande de sa clientèle ce qui crée par conséquent une diminution importante de celle-ci ce qui entraîne de ce fait la baisse de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons . ce qui lui permettra de retenir et gagner la clientèle mais plus précisément d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. benefice qui lui permettra d'une part d'agrandir et d’aménager sa structure et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bibien is a 44-year-old woman who is separated and the mother of four. She has been running a bar in a district in the capital for ten years where she sells bottled beverages and food. Over the course of time, she acquired experience in this domain enabling her to earn a considerable customer base. Unfortunately, her meager stock of goods prevents her from satisfying customer demand appropriately. As a result, her customer base has shrunk significantly leading to a drop in sales and thus her profits. 

So Bibien is requesting this loan to be able to purchase more cases of beverages enabling her to retain her customers and have more of them, but to the point to increase her sales and profit. The profit will allow her in part to expand her bar and renovate it and also to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs a service based business proving Tricycle rental and transportation to make a living. She has been doing this for two years earning enough for their basic needs. 

Victoria has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new tires to improve the transportation services. She always finds ways to augment their income. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en: Maris Stella has owned and operated a specialized general store for eight years, earning well for the family. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and had successfully repaid a previous loan that she used for the business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Elsa Angelica

texts.es: La  señora Elsa tiene 31 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Villa Adela,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Elsa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como: papa y abarrotes al por mayor,  la señora Elsa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona  hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida ya que es una zona comercial, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Elsa is 31 and is married with four children. For a long time she has worked selling food from her home in the Villa Adela area. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy supplies for making food, such as potatoes and other wholesale groceries. Elsa faces many challenges in her business due to competition; as it is a commercial zone there are many other places selling food in the area. She is going to use the money to buy more ingredients for her delicious dishes. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Mr Komi marié à une revendeuse est père de 04 enfants. Il est meunier de profession et exerce son activité à domicile. Le second prêt sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter un autre moulin pour rendre service à ses clients. Il a démarré en 2012 et espère agrandir son activité, subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Komi is married to a saleswoman and they have four children.  He is a professional miller and runs his business from his home.

This will be Komi's second loan with the field partner, WAGES, and it will allow him to buy another mill to provide his customers with the service they require.

Komi started his business in 2012, and he hopes to be able to expand his business and provide better for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
La dame Bineta, fait de la vente de denrées alimentaires. Elle a démarré en 2008 avec un capital de 25000FCFA avec une étale devant la maison. Bineta en est à son tout premier crédit à l’IMCEC et voudrait acheter  des pastèques, des oranges, comme c’est la période, pour revendre.
Bineta est mariée et mère de famille ; et c’est grâce aux bénéfices, minimes soient ils, qu’il appuie son mari pour les dépenses de la maison, mais aussi ses parents.
Bineta a envie un jour, d’ouvrir une supérette pour vendre des denrées diverses. Mais avec sa  seule source de revenu elle n’y arrivera pas d’ici des années, il lui faut donc l’appuie d’une Institution financière qui puisse lui donner un coup de main.
texts.en:
Bineta sells basic foodstuffs.  She started her business in 2008 with a capital of 25,000 francs CFA, and sold her products from the front of her home.

This will be the first loan for Bineta from the field partner, UIMCEC, and she will use her loan to buy watermelons and oranges which are both in season.

Bineta is married and has children.  Thanks to her earnings, however small they may be, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses, and also help her parents.

One day, Bineta would like to open a mini-market to sell food products.  However, it would take years for her to make enough money to achieve this on her own.  Therefore, she is relying on the support of the field partner to give her a helping hand.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS está compuesto por nueve  integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Gregoria tiene 31 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de ocho años y de 4 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, electrodomésticos  también celulares, cargadores, accesorios, etc, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios de celulares por mayor  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, la señora Gregoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, se siente feliz ya agradecida por ella  y también por sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso sacan solas adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) is made up of nine members, eight women and one man.  They make a living in different activities.  The president of the bank is Gregoria who is 31 years old and has two children who are eight and four years old.  She makes a living selling various items, electrical household appliances and also cell phones, chargers, accessories, etc.  This loan is the first sequence within the institution.  She is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale cell phone accessories.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she has orders from her clients.  

Gregoria faces challenges in her business such as the lack of capital and she is going to use the benefits in the growth of the business.  Her desire for her business is to have greater income and to support her family financially and in this way improve their quality of life.  She feels happy and grateful both for herself and for her fellow group members since in many cases they are moving their families forward by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena de 25 años de edad, está casada y vive en la casa de su mamá tienen dos personas dependientes de sus ingresos su madre y su hijo. Su actividad principal es la producción de leche cruda, para lo cual cuenta con 10 cabezas de ganado vacuno lechero, 8 se encuentran en producción y 2 se encuentran preñadas, además su esposo se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte de pasajeros como taxista desde hace 6 años, de esta manera ambos generan sus ingresos, realizando sus actividades con responsabilidad y muchas ganas de superarse. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero, de esta manera mejora sus ingresos y lograra satisfacer sus necesidades económicas, buscando el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 25 years of age, married, and lives in her mother's house with 2 people dependent upon her income -- her mother and her son. Maria Elena's principal activity is the production of fresh milk, for which she can count on 10 head of milk cows; 8 are producing and 2 are currently pregnant. 

In addition, her husband has driven a taxi for the last 6 years. In this manner, they both generate income, carrying out their activities with responsibility and much desire to get ahead.

Presently, Maria Elena is requesting a loan to purchase more milk cows. She hopes in this way to improve her income and satisfy economic needs, advancing her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy additional milk cows.

loans.name: Raphael Frédéric

texts.fr: Raphael est une homme de 29 ans célibataire et père  d'un enfant 4 mois. Il est commerçant et dispose d'un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis quelques années. Il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital . Il voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter les casiers de boissons afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle . cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Raphael is a 29-year-old man who is unmarried and the father of a 4-year-old child. Raphael is a merchant and has owned a bar in a district in the capital for a few years. He benefits from good experience in this domain. But his capital no longer allows him to satisfy all of his customers, who sometimes have to turn to the competition. This is due to his meager capital. 

With this loan, Raphael would like to increase his cases of beverages in order to satisfy customer demand. This will also increase his sales, as well as his profits. The revenues generated will enable him to do better in meeting family needs and in expanding his business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beverages

loans.name: Ferdinand Bertrand

texts.fr: Bertrand est une homme de 30 ans célibataire et père  de 2 enfants de 2 et 3 ans. Il est commerçant et dispose d'un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis quelques années. Il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital . Il voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter les casiers de boissons afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle . cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Bertrand is a 30-year-old man who is unmarried and the father of two children, aged 2 and 3 years old. He is a merchant and has owned a bar in a district in the capital for a few years. He benefits from good experience in this domain. But his capital no longer allows him to satisfy all of his customers, who sometimes have to turn to the competition. This is due to his meager capital. 

With this loan, Bertrand would like to increase his cases of beverages in order to satisfy customer demand. This will also increase his sales, as well as his profits. The revenues generated will enable him to do better in meeting family needs and in expanding his business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beverages

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Marie Jeanne est une femme de 43 ans célibataire et mère de famille.Elle est commerçante et vend du poisson d'eau douce dans un marché de la capitale depuis 13 ans. c'est grâce à ça qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter le poisson en petite quantité ne rapporte vraiment grand chose D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de poisson, Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Marie Jeanne is a 43-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of a family. She is a merchant and has been selling fresh water fish at a market in the capital for thirteen years. Thanks to this business, she is taking care of her family. Because she purchases fish in small quantities, she does not really earn much, thus the importance of this business loan, since it will enable her to increase her stock of fish. And it will prevent extra trips each day and reduce her taxi costs. And so her profits will increase. She will reinvest part of her profits in her business, and the rest will help her to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Dora Eugenia

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer activa y emprendedora, a sus 43 años de edad se dedica a atender su propia tienda de abarrotes, la cual inició hace dos meses con el fin de mejorar la economía familiar y apoyar a su esposo para solventar las necesidades básicas; la idea surgió aprovechando la experiencia de más de 3 años que obtuvo trabajando en diferentes negocios similares; su jornada laboral es de lunes a domingo desde las primeras horas de la mañana y ofrece productos de primera necesidad en el hogar.
El propósito principal que Dora quiere alcanzar es el fortalecimiento de su negocio para lograr que sea reconocido en la zona y le garantice una rentabilidad favorable para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Intentando cumplir su objetivo, se anima a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, lácteos, carnes frías, chocolate, galletería, productos de panadería, huevos, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le permitirá diversificar su inventario y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus compradores, aumentando las ventas y por ende el margen de ganancia que obtiene; dinero con el que podrá seguir solventando algunos gastos familiares y reinvirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora, 43, is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She operates a grocery business that she started two months ago because she wanted to help her husband with their everyday expenses and improve the family's finances.  A grocery business made the most sense because she had more than 3 years of experience working at similar businesses before and she wanted to make the most of what she learned.  She works Mondays to Sundays, from early in the morning.  She sells the everyday products that everyone needs.  
Dora's immediate goal is to strengthen her business so that it becomes the "go-to" grocery for the area.  Her long-term goal is to build a profitable business that will, in turn, provide a better life for her family.  
Dora is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of merchandise (soft drinks, dairy, cold meats, chocolate, snacks, baked goods, eggs and other everyday grocery products) for her grocery business.  The investment will allow her to offer a wider range of products and meet demand from local shoppers.  Her margins will go up, she says, and she will use the profit to reinvest in the business and help provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Felomina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 44 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc. Glenda has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gara

texts.en:
Gara is 46 years old and married with three children who are in school. Gara works very hard to provide for her children.

Gara runs a buy and sell tires business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tires to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of retail items. 

In the future, Gara would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tires to sell.

loans.name: Lilliam Yaneth

texts.es:
Liliam, se dispone a incrementar los productos de su inventario ya que su negocio tiene mayor afluencia de clientes y sus demandas son más, comprara cereales, arroz, bebidas, frijol, y jabón, con lo que seguirá teniendo productos que sus clientes necesitan y de esta amera tenerlos satisfechos.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento la variedad de productos de la canasta básica que ofrecía a sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaron y sus ganancias son mejore, las cuales utiliza para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos. Todos los miembros de su familia se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en:
Lilliam would like to increase the products in her inventory since her business has a larger influx of customers as well as more demand.  She will buy cereals, rice, beverages, beans, and soap so that she can continue having products that her customers needs.  This will keep them satisfied.  

With her previous loan, Lilliam increased the variety of basic household products that she could offer to her customers.  Her sales increased and her earnings improved, which allowed her to fulfill her financial commitments.  All of her family members are in very good health.

loans.use: to buy cereals, rice, beverages, beans, and soap.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children. Two of her children are still at school and the other one is still small. She has been running a bar for one year now. She opens her bar from 7am to after mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.   

This will be Mariam’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy drinks like beers, sodas, juice, water and has been able to pay back her loan successfully. She is so hard working and it shows! She appreciates all those who have supported her group Torees, whose members have been able to take their children to schools and colleges. They have been able to make a good living. 

Mariam used the profits to pay for the  DSTV programme and to buy water for the family use. She will use this loan to buy drinks to meet her customers’ demands. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group “Torees”, which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”  está conformada por 07 socios trabajadores en diferentes comercios. Susana de 24 años es una de sus integrantes,  lleva trabajando con el grupo varios años, en la actualidad es la presidenta del grupo. Hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de mayólicas empezó ayudando en la tienda de su padre, hoy en día es independiente  y hace 04 años tiene su propia tienda de mayólicas. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mayólicas de diferentes modelos para satisfacer a su clientela, mas adelante le gustaría crecer y abrir más sucursales de su negocio. Susana en representación del  grupo agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por este préstamo, en la foto es la última del lado derecho, viste casaca deportiva color rojo y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Decididas e Independientes" (Determined and Independent Women) consists of seven hardworking members who engage in different businesses.

Susana, age 24, is one of the members.  She has worked with this group for several years and currently serves as the group president.  For the past 10 years, she has been selling glazed pottery.  Susana started out by helping at her father's store.  Today she is independent and has managed her own pottery shop for the past four years.  The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of glazed pottery in different styles so that she can satisfy her customers.  Moving forward, she would like to grow and open additional branches of her business.  

On behalf of her group, Susana would like to thank the Kiva lenders for this loan.  In the photo, she is standing on the far right, wearing a red sports jacket and gray trousers.

loans.use: to buy glazed pottery to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Silvia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de dos hijos ya independientes. Tiene 52 años de edad. Se dedica al negocio de librería. Inicio su negocio hace varios años, con el dinero de sus liquidación fue comprando poco a poco lapiceros y cuadernos; luego con las ganancias obtenidas fue comprando vitrinas para exhibir sus productos. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio surtido y próspero. Su meta próxima es lograr surtir su librería. Solicita el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares tales como: Lapiceros, cuadernos, reglas, marcadores, calculadoras entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mantener su negocio.
texts.en: Silvia is from Granada.  She is married and the mother of two adult children.  She is 52 years old and has a bookstore.  She started her business several years ago with the money she got as severance and she bought pencils and notebooks a little at a time.  Then she bought display cases to show her products and now has a well-stocked and successful business.  Her next goal is to stock her bookstore.  She is asking for this loan to buy school supplies such as pencils, notebooks, rulers, markers, calculators, etc.  She estimates that this loan will help her satisfy her customer demand.  Her plans for the future are to maintain her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Felix Nabor

texts.es: El señor Felix  tiene un nivel de educacion bachiller y viene de una familia trabajadora con buenos valores y buena administracion de recursos economicos. Comenzó en su actividad de carpinteria desde hace mas de 30 años, empezando a trabajar como ayudante y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta que se volvió independiente contando con su propia maquinaria la cual fue conseguida con sus propios recursos. Actualmente solicita un credito para la compra tablones de madera para realizar su trabajo en ese material, el mismo que le falto por la demanda de trabajos que tiene en estas epocas, de esta forma obtendra ingresos suficientes para cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Felix  has his secondary school education and comes from a hard-working family with good values and good management of their financial resources. He started his work as a carpenter more than 30 years ago. He began as an assistant and little by little he gained experience. He started working for himself having his own equipment which he obtained with his own resources. 

Now he is requesting a loan to buy wood planks to do some work with this material himself. He doesn't have any orders right now and doing this he will generate enough income to cover his expenses and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy planks of wood.

loans.name: Norelia Wvieda

texts.es:
Norelia, a sus 37 años de edad, es una madre ejemplar que ha sacado adelante a sus 5 hijos de 16, 13 y trillizos de 8 años, pues es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo y, con el dinero mensual que él le da, no le alcanza para solventar las necesidades de su numerosa familia. Es por ello que con el apoyo de diferentes ciclos de crédito compró máquinas de confección y puso en marcha su propio taller, el oficio lo aprendió cuando realizó cursos de capacitación en confección, ya que es una arte que le siempre le ha gustado y gracias a ello, hoy en día le confecciona a terceros y, adicionalmente saca producción de pijamas y ropa para niños de su línea propia, así genera recursos suficientes para dar sustento a sus hijos; trabaja todos los días de 6 am a 8 pm y una de sus hijas le colabora con la terminación y pulido de las prendas.
Con el apoyo del crédito que solicita desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones), para sacar producción de camisas blancas de uniforme, para aprovechar la temporada escolar que comienza, así tendrá mejores ventas y aumentará los ingresos.
Norelia sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por lo que desea seguir luchando para fortalecer su negocio, ampliarlo y comprar otras 3 máquinas, además desea generar empleo a otras madres cabeza de hogar, que como ella desean lo mejor para sus hijos; así mejorará la calidad de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Norelia, 37, is a perfect mom.  She is raising 5 children--one 16-year old, one 13-year old and 8-year old triplets--and raising them alone now that she's separated from her husband.  Support from her husband isn't enough to meet all the needs of such a large family so Norelia started her own sewing business to generate an extra income.  A sewing business made the most sense to her because she'd always liked sewing.  She built the business with past loans, taking classes, buying sewing machines and setting up her own workshop.  She makes clothing to order and has her own line of pajamas and clothing for children.  The business is profitable and helps provide for her children.  Norelia works every day from 6am to 8pm and can rely on help from one of her daughters to finish orders.  
Norelia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--material, thread, buttons--to make school uniforms ahead of the coming school-year.  The investment will allow her to sell more and increase her income.  
Norelia wants a better future for her children and says she'll keep working to build and expand her business.  She also wants to create jobs for other mothers like her who want to build better lives for their children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Domingo Santo

texts.es:
Domingo es un campesino de 50 años de edad, que se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas del campo para ganarse la vida, trabaja como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región de 6 a 11 am y, de manera independiente posee cultivos cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside; así genera los recursos para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), con los que continuará cuidando sus cultivos y podrá tener una cosecha mucho más productiva, generando un incremento en las ventas y por ende las utilidades que recibe.
Domingo manifiesta que su único objetivo es seguir trabajando para mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida y poder continuar con sus cultivos, para que le generen el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Domingo, 50, has made his living from farm work for all of his life.  He works as a day laborer on local farms from 6am to 11am and has land of his own where he grows and raises crops for sale in the local market.  His income covers his basic expenses.
Domingo is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizers and pesticides, for example--to carry on his farming business and ensure a good yield from his next crop.  
Domingo says that his only goal is to continue working so that he can go on supporting himself and improving, however little, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Loriphen

texts.en:
Loriphen helps her husband in their farm, raising pigs for sale. She has been doing this for a year and she earns well for the family. Her husband is also engaged in a service based business providing tricycle transportation. 

Loriphen took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feed to boost her pigs. She plan to improve the business in order to provide a better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy pigfeed.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 32 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Desiree is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Desiree has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Desiree would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is married and has six children. She is 54 years old and two of her children are in school. Alita is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, fishing nets, etc.

Alita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, fishing nets, etc

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 40-year old lady. She spends her life with her 3 daughters and 2 sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Ghulam Fatima is taking loan for her son who owns a small embroidery firm in partnership with his uncle. He has been running this business for many years. He has become very expert in his profession and knits very fine embroidery by machine on dresses. There are many skill persons working in the firm. They prepare embroidery dresses on a large scale. He wants to buy enough cloth to fulfill the needs of a large scale business. 

Ghulam Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy cloth to do embroidery. Ghulam Fatima is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 50 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her five children, one of whom is still in school.

Rosario runs a weaving bamboo business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. Rosario has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of retail items. 

In the future Rosario would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Les Gédeons Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Dorothe est une brave commerçante, dynamique, senior entrepreneur depuis 25 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Les Gédéons », âgée de 63 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants, qui tous, ont terminé les études. Elle est vendeuse de braise dans les artères de la ville. Elle étale ses activités dans un dépôt tout au long de la route. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 45 sacs de braises. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son ancien mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, nourrir ses enfants et préparer leur avenir. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Dorothe, is a good and honest merchant. An energetic senior entrepreneur for 25 years, she is a member of a business association "Les Gédéons". As a 63-years old widow and mother, she has two children, who are both finished with school. Dorothe sells charcoal on city streets. She is setting up her business in a warehouse on the roadside. She is requesting a  loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 45 sacks of charcoal. She started her business with funds from her former husband. For the future, she would like to increase her capital, feed her children, and prepare for their future.

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans during this time of conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: El joven Roly tiene 26 años y es Soltero,  se dedica a la actividad de sastrería confeccionando trajes como distinto tipo de ropa tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Cachilaya,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y Roly va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una máquina de coser para realizar un mejor trabajo ya que la que tiene le está presentando algunas fallas, y el joven tiene muchos pedidos de trajes que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas de fin de año tiene mucha demanda, el joven Roly es un apersona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roly is 26 years old and is single. He 	is sewing, making suits as well as distinct types of clothing. His shop is in Cachilaya. This is his first loan with the Institute and Roly will use the loan to buy a sewing machine to do better work	 as the ones he has have a few deficiencies. He has lots of orders for suits that he has to deliver. The end of the year brings lots of demand. Young Roly is a hard-working person with much desire to go on improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dinelza

texts.es: La señora Dinelza vive actualmente con su madre en un barrio que fue recientemente urbanizado, tiene su lote urbano, en el cual su vivienda se encuentra en construcción. Su actividad económica consiste en la producción de piña al partido y trabaja en el lote agrícola de su madre, quien se encarga de  la compra de los insumos y la venta de la producción,  las ganancias de la venta se las dividen a la mitad , la señora se encarga específicamente de toda la producción con personal eventual y sus ingresos son estacionarios. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la construcción de su vivienda, con la conclusión del  proyecto lograra vivir más cómodamente y con un amplio espacio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Sra. Dinelza lives with her mother in an area that was recently urbanized.  She has an urban plot of her own where she is building a house.  Sra. Dinelza and her mother have a farming business where they grow pineapple.  Her mother is responsible for buying the supplies they need for the business and selling the crop.  Sra. Dinelza is responsible for production and for hiring any farm labor that she needs to ensure a good yield.  Income from the business is seasonal.  Sra. Dinelza is applying for a loan that she will use to build her house.  The investment will make the house more comfortable and provide the extra space she needs.

loans.use: to pay housing expenses.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr: Ibrahim est  un jeune homme de 31 ans père de 3 enfants. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 3 ans déjà, il fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'il sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Ibrahim is a 31-year-old father of three children. After his training, he opened a small clothing workshop which has been doing well for the past three years. He also able to do embroidery, but he does not possess all the materials he needs in order to keep up with demand and to satisfy his customers. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan in order to purchase fabrics and clothes-making equipment (pins, needles, lining, thread) which will remove the need for him to go to the market all the time. This way, he will be able to create clothes then sell them directly to his customers. The profits from this loan will not only allow him to buy clothes-making materials in order to grow his business, but they will also go towards paying for some of his personal needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for making clothes

loans.name: Roeu's Group

texts.en:
A young mother with three kids, Roeu is 28 years old, a borrower from MongKol Borey in Banteay Meanchey province. To feed the family, she and her husband grow vegetables and make bamboo baskets for sale. She has been doing this for eight years. These businesses earn her 32,800 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan helped to keep her children in school and made her family’s living better. She and her group member are applying for 1,100,000 KHR. As the borrower this time, Roeu will use her entire loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing fees for her farming. She hopes that her farming will return more crop yield and give her family a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing fees for her farming

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Samoerun

texts.en:
Samoeurn is 40 years old, a resident of Treng district in Takeo province. She has three kids with all of her children studying in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming and pig raising and she is also a teacher. Having been in this business for 19 years, she can earn about $12 per day. 

She is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In the past it helped her family’s situation improve and she could keep her children in school. Now, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund to cover her brother's school fees in nursing. She hopes that her brother will have a good job and future after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover her brother's school fees in nursing.

loans.name: Lucio Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cocoa por mayor, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cocoa por quintales ya que esta época de fin de año por navidad y año nuevo  tiene mucha demanda de este producto ya que se hacen distintas chocolatatas para niños de distintas instituciones así que quiere abastecerse de este producto y así generar más ingresos esta época se siente muy agr5adecido pór la oportunidad que Kiva le brinda para hacer crecer su megocio.
texts.en: Lucio continues with the same activity which is selling cocoa wholesale. He comments that his last loan was successful when he bought cocoa by the quintal. And now with the end of the year with Christmas and New Year he has much demand for his product. Different institutions have chocolatatas (like a tea party, but with chocolate) for children. So Lucio wants to stock up with this product and generate more income in this busy time. He is very grateful for the opportunity that Kiva is giving him to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa (powdered chocolate) by quintales (100-kilogram units).

loans.name: Edgar Victor

texts.es: El señor Edgar tiene 39 años, es casado y vive en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene tres hijos dependientes que se encuentran estudiando en un colegio fiscal, el señor solo pudo terminar el colegio y no la universidad debido a que sus padres no tenían suficientes recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos de todos sus hermanos por lo que tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven. Actualmente su principal ingreso proviene del servicio de transporte, pero no logra cubrir todos los gastos de su familia, por ello su esposa empezó a trabajar y realiza el servicio de maquila, es decir costura de pantalones jeans clásicos y juveniles. El crédito solicitado es para terminar la construcción de su vivienda ya que les falta dinero para la culminación, de esta forma quiere brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, y mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Sr. Edgar, 39, is married and lives in a southern neighborhood of Cochabamba.  He has three children, at home, all three of whom study in fee-based schools.  Sr. Edgar was unable to go on to college from high school because his parents needed him to work and help support the family.  He has always worked and now has his own taxi business.  His income doesn't stretch to meet all the family's expenses, though, and his wife has a business of her own, making clothing for teens and adults.  Sr. Edgar is applying for a loan that he will use to finish building his house.  He doesn't have the funds to complete it now and he wants to provide his family with a decent place to live.

loans.use: to pay housing expenses.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El señor  Juan José tiene 35 años, está casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en una casa muy antigua en alquiler en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Se dedica al servicio de transporte como taxista libre y solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que el mismo está en el mecánico y necesita sacarlo para comenzar a trabajar y seguir generando ingresos con el fin de cubrir los gastos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Juan José is 35 years old, married and has no dependent children. He lives in a very old rental house in the South area of the city of Cochabamba. He works in transportation as a taxi driver and is requesting a loan to maintain his vehicle. He is the mechanic and he needs to do this in order to start to work. He needs to generate the income to cover his expenses and satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente feliz por el préstamo, ella  continua  atendiendo su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo panetones, champeas, galletas, dulces, chocolates, leche, sacos de  azúcar, sacos de harina, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más. 

Luisa  sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is grateful to the lenders and is pleased with the loan. She continues to take care of her small grocery store in her house where she sells different products like rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, etc. She has had this business for a number of years and things are going well for her.

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise like panettone (Italian sweet bread), champeas, biscuits, sweets, chocolate, milk, bags of sugar, rice, flour, etc. Luisa continues to belong to the "Virgen del Rosario” communal bank. She values and is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like panettones (Italian sweet bread), biscuits, sweets, chocolates, milk, bags of sugar, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Don Marvin es originario de la ciudad de Managua. De 42 años de edad. Se dedica a la Sastrería. Inicio su negocio como una forma de entretenimiento, luego le fue interesando e inicio su propio negocio. Actualmente su negocio está creciendo y cumpliendo con las necesidades de sus clientas. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como: Tela, Hilos, Botones entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para obtener el material necesario y brindar respuesta inmediata a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer el taller en otro local y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marvin is a native of the city of Managua.  He is 42 years old.  He makes a living as a tailor.  He started in this business as a form of entertainment, then he got interested in it and he started his own business.  Currently his business is growing and he is meeting the needs of his customers.  

He is requesting the loan to purchase materials such as fabric, thread and buttons among other things.  He thinks that the loan will be of great help to him in obtaining the necessary materials and offering an immediate response to his customers.  His future plan is to establish the workshop in another location and increase his number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric, thread and buttons, among other things.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
A few years ago Farzana, a 28-year-old married mother of four, decided to start a stitching school business in her home to meet her household expenses. An expert in stitching fine clothes, she decided to teach her arts to the girls of her area. Farzana teaches and stitches for the people in her neighbourhood, using the income to support her entire family.

Farzana contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan  to buy an  additional sewing machine for the practice of her students. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her school in the future.

loans.use: To buy new a sewing machine for her stitching school.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 49 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell. 

Merlina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Merlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 23-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. 

She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family. Her sewing machine has become out of order, and due to a lack of savings and funds, Nadia is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create a means of increasing revenue so she may generate a healthier source of income.

Nadia hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her and help her to get more income.

Nadia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d'ignames et de céréales, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2006. Elle dispose d'une grande clientèle dont des propriétaires de restaurant et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays. Son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des ignames et des céréales.
