Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Le gain tiré de la vente lui servira d'assurer l'éducation des enfants tout en agrandissant son activité.
texts.en:
This lady earns a living selling yams and cereals. She began this business in 2006. She has a sizeable clientele that includes restaurant owners, and she buys her merchandise in the back country. Her inventory is down, and so she would like to replenish it. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy yams and cereals. 

She is married with children. The revenue earned through her sales will help her to support her children’s education while also being able to expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy yams and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen helps her husband to earn a living by managing their corn production business while he works for a company as a security guard. A farmer for 15 years, she earns enough to support the needs of her four children. 

Ellen has requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new variety of seeds for the next cropping. She hopes to earn more profit for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seeds for the next cropping

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is the age of 38. She lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in the market. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. Due to quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his stock and buy milk in large quantity, but he does not have enough money to buy milk in large quantity. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more milk to sell and can get maximum income.

Rubina is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 40-year-old woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to an ultra poor family. Her husband is the only one who has been contributing to household expenses. Her son has been learning driving of a rickshaw from his father. Razia has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but mostly savings are spent on household expenses. 

Razia she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son but she does not have enough money. Therefore, Razia requested a loan for her son so that he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings.  She hopes that her son will drive the auto rickshaw and earn sufficient income.

Razia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Quirina is 52 years old and her two children are in school.

Quirina has a buy and sell bananas business in the Philippines. Quirina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Quirina has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Quirina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina works hard to support her family. Ludivina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ludivina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. Ludivina has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Sobina

texts.en: Sobina is smart, young woman. She was born in 1995. She graduated school with excellent marks. Now, she is a student of the first course. She studies at the Tajik Russian Slavonic University. She studies at the Economist faculty. Sobina is good at all subjects. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en: Nasimjon is a very, clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computer science, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. Nowadays, he is a third year student of the National Tajik University. His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Nasimjon’s study at the university. Nasimjon wants to be one of the best specialists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan to pay for study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad del lavado de arena y venta de la misma, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de una bomba de agua de mayor potencia para el lavado de arena, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra  compra de herramientas de trabajo,   se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Juan continues in his same business activity, sand blasting. He says that it went well for him with the previous loan because he used it to buy a more powerful water pump to blast the sand. 

On this occasion, he is asking for the loan to buy work tools.  He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity he is being given to grow his business and improve his quality of life.  This is the only business activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Pablo Elmer

texts.es: Pablo de 23 años de edad es soltero y habita junto a su padre y abuela en casa propia. Es un joven muy trabajador y responsable quien se gana la vida trabajando como empleado de una fábrica cercana a su localidad. Su vivienda es muy humilde y  la cubierta del techo se encuentra dañada por causa de las lluvias  y del sol. Por lo anterior desea cambiar el techo lo antes posible ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder a hacer las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en: Pablo, 23, is single and lives with his father and grandmother in their own house. This hardworking, responsible young man makes his living working at a factory in his neighborhood. His house is very modest, and the roof has been damaged by rain and the sun. He wants to replace the roof as soon as possible because water seeps through it when it rains. He has applied to FUSIA for a loan to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to do the repairs as soon as he can.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Bayarzaya

texts.en: Bayarzaya is a bachelor's degree student, who studies in public university as a journalist. At the moment, graduating her university is her main goal. She has mentioned that everyone has a dream and goal so she works very hard to graduate her university. She would really like to get job and give financial support to her family. Without the loan, it would be really difficult to pay her tuition fee and she is very grateful for it.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 29ans avec un enfant de 05ans en charge, Akouvi a appris comme activité la coiffure. Après son apprentissage, elle a ouvert son atelier et revend aussi des mèches et des défrisants. Pour augmenter son stock par l'achat de ses produits, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et d'assurer la bonne santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
This young woman, age 29, has a 5-year-old dependent child. She learned hairstyling, and after finishing her training, she opened a hair salon where she also sells hair extensions and straightening products. 

To bolster her stock of products to sell, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES. Her profits will allow her to expand her activity and to ensure her family’s good health.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, straighteners, etc.

loans.name: Joventino

texts.en:
Joventino is a married man and a father of ten grown children. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. He earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in his locality. This is the source of his income.

Joventino is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candy, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack  foods  and other things. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stocks thus attracting more buyers to his store. 

In the future, Joventino hopes to make his store a success and a sustainable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candy, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods and others things.

loans.name: Jeodelyn

texts.en:
This is Jeodelyn. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jeodelyn dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
Jenith is married with three children. She runs a general store in her community while her husband works as a government employee. She has run the general store for five years, earning well for the needs of the entire family. 

Jenith borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business to have a stable source of income for a better living for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has operated a retail shop which is doing well and is helping her to support her family. In addition, she operates a tailoring business to supplement her income. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Emelita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Emelita is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Al-Rayan Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Rayan. It consists of 4 members who are ladies. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Ramadhana is 41 years old and married with children. She works in food production. This business gives her substantial income, which allows her to provide for her family and meet her own needs. In order to increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 20,000 YER to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc. for her business. In the future, she hopes to improve the quality of her food production.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de ferretería donde vende diferentes productos como por ejemplo calaminas, clavos, alambres, pinturas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pinturas, clavos, tornillos, cerraduras, siliconas y otras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.

Herminia nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 45 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”.
texts.en:
Herminia thanks the lenders for the funding and is pleased with the support. She is still running her hardware store, where she sells a variety of merchandise like corrugated iron, nails, screws, wire, and paint. She now needs a loan to buy merchandise such as paint, nails, screws, locks, and silicone. She is thankful for and appreciates the loan and promises to make her monthly payments on time. 

Herminia was born in the city of Puno but now lives in Paucartambo. She is 45 years old and has a partner, with whom she has three children. Herminia is a hard-working and enterprising mother, who, through her work, is supporting her family. She is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as paint, nails, screws, locks, silicone and more.

loans.name: Ana Celena

texts.es: Ana es una mujer dedicada a las responsabilidades familiares y laborares es bien activa en sus gestiones, es casada con 1 hijo a quien le da el apoyo para que se desarrolle, esta señora visito ceprodel para ser beneficiado con crédito para embaldosar cuarto y pared ya que el mismo lo utilizaría para la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrín y mano de obra., y de esa manera lograr  su sueño para tener mejores condiciones con su familia
texts.en: Ana is dedicated to her family responsibilities and chores and actively manages them. She is married and has a year-old son, whose development is important to her. Ana came to Ceprodel for a loan to tile a room and wall. She will use the loan to buy buildings supplies like cement, sand, and gravel and to pay laborers so that she can realize her dream of making her family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy buildings supplies like cement, sand, and gravel and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Brenda Mercedes

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer visionaria además de ser  maestra de educación primaria ejerce la actividad de venta de servicio de transporte de acarreo de personal a una empresa, es Viuda con 1 hijo el que solo ella lo mantiene dándole el apoyo para su desarrollo ya que su esposo falleció hace 3 años.
Actualmente se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para la construcción de un cuarto ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín, arena y mano de obra, mejora que le vendría a dar mejor bienestar a su familia
texts.en:
Brenda is a visionary woman.  In addition to being a primary school teacher, she provides transportation of personnel services to a company.  She is a widow with one child.  She is the only one who supports him.  She gives him support so that he can grow because her husband passed away three years ago.

She currently came to CEPRODEL to request a loan to build a room.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement blocks, iron, gravel, sand, and to pay for the labor.  This improvement will improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement blocks, iron, gravel, sand, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Depuis 2003, madame Eya s'est donnée au commerce de chaussures. Cette activité qu'elle mène lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Vue que les périodes de fin d'année s'approche, elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des chaussures pour revendre. Le profit l'aidera à assurer son bien - être et rendre pérenne son activité. Elle est âgée de 30ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eya, age 30, has been selling shoes since 2003. This activity allows her to earn enough to support herself. 

With the year-end fast approaching, she is seeking a 2nd loan to buy shoes to sell. Her profits will help her to sustain her activity and to ensure her own well-being.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 21-year-old farmer currently living in Wedza, Zimbabwe. She is married and a mother of one. She started the business when she got married and it has been running for two years. Her husband owns a small plot of land where she farms potatoes and sells them to her community. Jane inspires young women in her community to take up farming as a business. 

Jane is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase farming equipment such as irrigation pipes, pumps, potato seeds and herbicides. She really loves farming and hopes to become a well-established and recognized supplier of potatoes. When the business expands, she will use the returns to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment such as irrigation pipes, pumps, potato seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 23-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and three sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 1999, her husband has a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Sobia is has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Sobia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to pay for goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Raynold is one of the members of the group called Amor y Esperanza (Love and Hope) 2. This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industries dominate the economy. Raynold makes his home in a simple structure with his three children and his long-term partner. He says that his most important challenge is to work hard by selling more products to provide for his family.

Raynold is excited to be taking his 8th loan with Esperanza, having repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying shoes, clothes and cosmetics such as body lotion, perfume, deodorant and other products. He will reinvest the profits in his business and take home money for food, clothes and other needs. His future plans are to develop a successful business within his local area. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Martha Licet

texts.es:
Martha es una señora dedicada a la enseñanza de los demás, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 10 años de laborar, es casada con 1 hijo al que le da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo.
Esta señora tiene la urgencia de construir una cocina por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrín, hierro, Bloques y mano de obra, el que le permitirá realizar la obra de sus sueños para obtener mejoría en las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who is devoted to teaching others.  She is an elementary school teacher by profession, and she has been working for ten years.  She is married and has one son.  She gives him all of the support he needs to develop.

This woman urgently needs to build a kitchen.  In order to do so, she visited CEPRODEL to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, iron, cement blocks, and to pay for the labor.  This will allow her to do the job of her dreams in order to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, iron, cement blocks, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Saida Vicenta

texts.es: Saida  se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria de un colegio de la zona donde vive con 17 años de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños el cual es su mayor anhelo, es casada con 1 hijo el que apoya en su desarrollo. Actualmente esta señora presenta una urgencia de mejorar su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y de esa manera alcanzar su sueño, dicho financiamiento lo utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, ladrillos, arena, piedrín, zinc, alambre de amarre, clavo y mano de obra. El que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones y lograra su sueño de darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Saida works as an elementary school teacher at a school in the area where she lives.  For 17 years she has been giving children a precious education, which is her biggest desire.  She is married and has one child whose development she supports.

She now urgently needs to improve her house.  In order to do so she visited CEPRODEL to request a loan.  This way she will fulfill her dream.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement, iron, bricks, sand, gravel, zinc, wire ties, nails, and to pay for the labor.  This would give her better living conditions, and she will fulfill her dream of giving her family improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, iron, bricks, sand, gravel, zinc, wire ties, nails, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah’s husband has a job in a firm. To increase his monthly income he planned to start a business in the evenings selling fruit. Due to a lack of funds, he is unable to start a small business. Therefore, Farah requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy initial inventory to start his fruit business.  

Farah is a responsible mother. She always pays attention to opportunities to reduce expenses and to reasonable resources to get more income. Her aim is to provide better facilties and living standards for her family. Now, she is hopeful that the new business will work out and provide their family with an increase in income.

Farah is very thankful to Kiva, honorable lenders, and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 26 years old. He is the father of a three-year-old child. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Sarain Dana

texts.es: La señorita Sarain es una persona de escasos recursos, actualmente vive con su madre y su tía a quienes ayudaba desde muy pequeña en el comercio de zapatos, de esa forma fue adquiriendo experiencia y poco a poco fue desarrollándose en el rubro, ahora sigue dedicándose a eso, revendiendo productos  de los mayoristas, tiene pensado seguir con sus estudios ya que actualmente su nivel de educación es el bachillerato y anhela agrandar su negocio por ello solicita un crédito para incrementar su capital de operación (comprando más mercadería),  ya que de esa manera mejorara su nivel de ventas, para cubrir sus gastos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sarain is poor. She lives with her mother and aunt, whom she has been helping sell shoes from an early age. She gained experience and slowly developed the skills for this trade, which is now her line of work. She resells merchandise she buys wholesale. She is thinking about continuing her studies; she graduated from high school. 

She wants to grow her business and has applied for a loan to increase her capital to buy more merchandise. This will increase her sales so that she can cover her expenses and help her family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi vit avec son mari tapissier à Lomé. Âgée de 27ans, elle a démarré en 2009 la vente des pagnes et des céréales à domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des pagnes et céréales afin de satisfaire les clients. Son désir est d'assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi, age 27, lives in Lomé with her husband, an upholsterer. In 2009, she started to sell pagnes and cereals from her home and as an itinerant vendor. 

She is seeking a 2nd loan to buy pagnes and cereals in order to meet customer demand. Her goal is to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Luisa  Idalia

texts.es: Luisa es una mujer que le gusta la convivencia con los niños y adolescentes de profesión licenciada en ingles, desempeñándose como maestra de educación secundaria en un núcleo educativo  de la zona donde vive, es soltera sin hijos a su cargo, actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar el techo de su vivienda por eso llego a ceprodel para solicitar  un financiamiento el que lo utilizara en la   Compra de materiales  de construcción como: perlin, zinc, electrodo, golosos y mano de obra el que le brindara las condiciones deseadas a su familia .
texts.en: Luisa likes being with children and teens. She has a degree in English, which she teaches at a local middle school. She is single and does not have any children. She needs to repair the roof of her house and has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to buy building supplies like beams, zinc, and electrodes and to pay laborers so that she can offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies like beams, zinc, and electrodes and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон родился в 1991 году в бедной и многодетной семье. Он с детства мечтал стать юристом. Умедчон в средней школе учился отлично. Он после окончания средней школы поступил в Таджикско-Российский Славянский Университет. Он учится по специальности юриста. Умедчон данное время является студентом 4 курса. Он часто посещает библиотеку и предпочитает читать как научную, так и художественную литературу. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор 4 курса, но так как он из многодетной семьи, его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Umedjon was born in 1991 to a poor family with many children. Since childhood he has dreamed of becoming a lawyer; he graduated as a top student from high school. After graduation Umedjon enrolled in the Tajikistan-Russian Slavic University to study to become a lawyer. He is now a 4th-year student, and often visits the library to read both scientific and fictional books. 

Umedjon needs to pay this year's tuition, but since he comes from a family with many siblings, his parents can't afford to pay his fees. He is requesting a loan to pay his tuition. Umedjon awaits your kindness and hopes for your kind-heartedness.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
John is in his early 30s and is married with one son who is still small.  He has been running a gengeduka (Swahili business selling fruits, vegetables and dry food like sugar, beans, backing flour, maize flour, salt, etc.)  He has been in this business for ten years now.  He works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be John’s  2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to start selling dry food.  He is doing great.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to buy small items for the gengeduka and to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to pay rent for a big shop where he will put his items and increase his stock.  He dreams of owning a wholesale and retail food shop.

John will share this with his loan group “Mloganzia,” which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay rent for a big shop where he  will put his items and increase his stock.

loans.name: Nedar Vicente

texts.es:
Nedar es un señor esforzado por darle mejores condiciones a su familia, es casado con 1 hijo al que le da el apoyo necesario para sus estudios secundarios. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de ampliar su vivienda con la construcción de cuarto, por eso se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr dicho sueño ya que labora como vigilante de un colegio de su localidad donde vive ya que por el bajo salario el crédito es la opción perfecta para lograr los sueños deseados, ya que dicho financiamiento lo utilizara en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro, zinc, piedrín, bloque y mano de obra.
Y de esa manera darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Nedar is a man who is determined to offer better conditions for his family. He is married and has a son for whom he provides the necessary help for his secondary school studies.

At present, Nedar needs to expand his home by constructing a room. For this reason, he approached Ceprodel to solicit financing to realize his dream. Nedar works as a night watchman for a school in the locality where he lives. Due to his low salary, a loan is the perfect option to achieve his desired goal. Nedar will use the funds to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, zinc, gravel, and cement blocks, and to pay laborers.

In this manner, he will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, zinc, gravel, and blocks, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua trabajando en su pequeño restaurante donde expende platos típicos de la región como por ejemplo caldo de gallina, malaya frita, pescado frito y otros. En esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo aceite, carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, verduras, latas de leche, bolsas de fideos y botellas de aceite. 

Concepción nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 46 años y es casada de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Concepción is grateful to the lenders for the loan and she feels very glad to have the support. She continues working in her small restaurant where she sells traditional regional dishes like chicken soup, fried steak, fried fish, and more. At this time, she needs the loan to buy ingredients like, for example, oil, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, vegetables, cans of milk, bags of noodles, and bottles of oil.

Concepción was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives there. She is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who provides for her family through the effort she puts into her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, vegetables, milk, noodles, and oil

loans.name: Mawufemo

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 23ans, Mawufemo pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des habits de façon ambulante. Son premier crédit lui servira à acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle espère réinvestir dans l'activité et mieux se prendre en charge. Mawufemo a démarré en 2011.
texts.en: Mawufemo is a young woman of 23. To make a living she sells clothing as an itinerant saleswoman. Her first loan will enable her to buy merchandise to satisfy her customers. She hopes to reinvest in her business and manage her life better. Mawufemo started her business in 2011.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 54 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Guillerma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 28 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet sells food consumables to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business, but she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu. With the loan she is requesting, Janet wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 39 years old. She is a mother of three children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 37-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. 

For 20 years her husband has run a welding shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Brac Pakistan. Shazia will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing one more welding plant for his shop as they have no other source of income. With the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son.

loans.use: To pay for metal items and tools.

loans.name: Marie Pulcherie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 40 ans mariée et mère de deux enfants âgée de 18 et 12 ans. Tous vont encore à l'école. Elle fait dans l'élévage des poules qu'elle revend. son activié fonctionne bien mais elle n'a pas assez de poussins alors elle est à chaque fois obligée de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisioner à nouveau d'ou la rupture permanente de ses stocks. c'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter ses stocks de poussins ainsi que la provende avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Ce dernier sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie is a 40 year old woman who is married and has two children aged 18 and 12. They both still attend school. She breeds chickens that she sells. Her business functions well, but she does not have enough chicks so every time she wants to buy some she has to sell her whole stock in order to be able to buy more which means that she is constantly  out of stock. That is why she requests this loan that will enable her to increase her stock of chicks to provide for the sales of the end of the year festivities. This will increase not only her sales, but also her profit. Some of her profits  will be invested to expand her business and the remainder will be used for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru: Махмудчон трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в 1990 года. Он окончил Таджикский Национальный Университет. Махмудчон в течение 2 лет, занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Однако его доход от данного бизнеса не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Его жена студентка. Махмудчон планирует организовать новый бизнес и находить, таким образом, нового источника дохода. Он решил организовать свой новый бизнес открытием интернет кафе. Махмудчон не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить компьютер и оплатить за аренду помещения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 долларов США для покупки компьютера, и оплатить за аренду помещения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahmudjon is an industrious man born in 1990. He graduated from the Tajik National University and has been running a taxi service for two years. But his income isn't sufficient to support his family. Mahmudjon is married with one child. His wife is a student. Mahmudjon is planning to open a new business and find a new source of income. He decided to open an internet cafe, but doesn't have enough money to buy a computer and pay the rent for the space. That is why is is asking for a loan of US$3,500. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a computer and pay the rent for an internet cafe.

loans.name: Bilol

texts.ru: Билол молодой и жизнерадостный молодой человек. Он родился в 1995 году. Билол учится в университете. Он студент 1 курса. Билол является одним из лучших студентов. Он всегда идет в университет подготовленный ко всем домашним заданиям. Билол усердно учится для того, чтобы получить хорошее образование и стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Билол не имеет денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bilol is a cheerful young man born in 1995. He is a university student in his first year. Bilol is one of the best students, and always goes to class with his homework completed. He is diligently studying to receive a good education and become a highly-qualified specialist. Bilol does not have the money needed to pay his tuition fees, and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Celina, who is in her early 50s, is married and has four children. Two of them have finished school, and the other two are still at school. Celina has been a food vendor for ten years. She works from 6:30am to 5:00pm daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Celina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to buy food supplies, to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Celina will share this loan with her loan group, “Imarika,” which has a total of five members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food supplies, to meed her customers' demand.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 27 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 9 años y dos  de  4 años de edad(gemelos). Marina se dedica al comercio especialmente de hierbas utilizadas para las comidas, tales como: espinaca, cilantro y mora. Su compañero de vida es agricultor y juntos unen esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y sencillas lo cual poco a poco desea ir mejorando. Actualmente el techo de su cocina se encuentra en mal estado y desea repararlo lo antes posible con el fin de proteger sus pocas pertenencias y a sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Marina is 27 years old and lives in the house that she owns with her life partner and their three children; the oldest is 9 years old and the twins are 4. Marina earns her living as a vender, especially of produce used for cooking, like spinach, cilantro, and berries. Her partner is a farmer and together they work to provide for their children. 

Their living conditions are very modest and simple, but they are improving them little by little. Currently, the roof of the kitchen is in bad condition, and she wants to repair it as soon as possible with the objective of protecting her children and her few belongings. 

For that reason, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of metal sheeting and beams. She hopes to have access to this financing since she currently does not have the capital to make this purchase by herself.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Santos Marlene

texts.es: Santos de 24 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija de 2 años de edad. Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de verduras y hortalizas tales como: güisquil, mora, chipilín y cilantro. De esta se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su familia. Para ella lo más importante es su hija y es por ella que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darle mejores condiciones de vida. Actualmente la cubierta del techo de la vivienda se encuentra dañado y además, el piso es de tierra y con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y grava para pavimentar el piso y cambiar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Santos is 24 and is a single mother of a two-year-old girl. She works at growing and selling vegetables and produce such as chayote fruit, blackberries, chipilín [a plant used as a herb in soups, etc.] and coriander. She earns her living in this way and is able to maintain her family. The most important thing for Santos is her daughter and she does everything in her power to giver her a better life. Currently the roof covering of her house is damaged and, in addition, the floor is made of earth.

She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to improve her living conditions. She wants it to buy galvanised sheeting, poles, cement, sand and gravel to pave the floor and to change the roof as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, poles, cement, sand and gravel to pave the floor and change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continúa dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, refrescos, verduras, carnes, gaseosas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar panetones, azúcar, chocolates, dulces pues desea incrementar el capital del negocio. 

Ella vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 65 años de edad y tiene siete hijos a quienes saca adelante ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos y esta implementada con la cosas básicas, ella a tiende a sus vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar.
texts.en:
Aniceta is grateful to the Kiva lenders and is happy for the support.  She continues to dedicate herself to selling primary needs products such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, soft drinks, vegetables, meats, and other things.  She has been in this business for several years and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she needs a loan to buy breads, sugar, chocolates, and candy and also wants to increase her working capital.
 
She lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo within the Cusco department.  She is 65 years old and has seven children.  [Aniceta] has a small store in her home, where she sells her products and it has the basic set up.  She serves her friends and neighbors with courtesy and friendliness and for this reason they always return to buy from her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi jeune femme de 26ans est restauratrice de profession. Elle exerce son activité dans un cafétariat et se fait aidée par 02 personnes. Pour l'avancement de son activité, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des produits alimentaires. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Essi, who is a young woman aged 26, is a restaurant owner by profession. She works in a cafeteria and has two people helping her. To help her business to progress, she requests a first loan to buy food products. She hopes to expand her business and manage her affairs better.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Abalo

texts.fr: Abalo âgé de 45ans vit avec sa femme et ses 02 enfants à Lomé. Il est revendeur de produits congelés et se fait aidée par 01 personne. Son troisième crédit l'aidera à acheter des marchandises. Il espère avec le profit ouvrir une boutique et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Abalo, aged 45, lives with his wife and two children in Lomé. He is a retailer of frozen products and is helped by one person. His third loan will help him to purchase some merchandise. With the profits, he hopes to open a shop and ensure that his family is self-sufficient in food.

loans.use: to purchase frozen products to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different products such as pepper, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking. Her earnings were a big help in the personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy different products such as pepper, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking. 

More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nida hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products such as pepper, laurel leaves, and potassium aluminum sulfate for repacking.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is running a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation in his community, which he has been doing for one year.  He earns enough to provide for the needs of his two children. 

Ruben is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to buy new tires to have better service. Ruben plans to buy another motorcycle to expand the business to have a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosila works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase vegetables, rice, meat, spices, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosila has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, rice, meat, spices, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, and eggs, etc. to sell.

Rosita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Rosita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, and eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 31 years old and married with two children; she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like coffee, noodles, bread, milk, juice, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Aileen has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Aileen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, noodles, bread, milk, juice, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nerene

texts.en:
This is Nerene, 33 years old, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to William, her business partner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

Nerene operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy different products such as peppers, bay leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

Nerene hopes to be successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products such as peppers, bay leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 40 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He is married with four children. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs the fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mary cooks food for sale at the market, and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 53 and married to a farmer. They have been working as maize farmers for the past three years. With the loan, Ferdinand would like to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is married and blessed with two children who are still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a café business in the future to earn more income to support her family.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Théophile Gautier

texts.fr: Théophile est un homme de 32 ans, il vie en concubinage et est père de 02 enfants. Il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 08 ans déjà et vend les vêtements homme, femme et enfant (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end dans d'autres grands marchés de la capitale pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité surtout avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Ce financement lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte pour mieux faire face à l'affluence des fêtes. Il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Théophile is a 32 year old man. He lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. He has been a salesman in a local market for eight years and sells men's, women's and children's clothing (according to the season and the bales). Due to the smallness of his capital he has to go to the unpacking in the other big markets of the capital every weekend to buy retail the clothing that he exposes on his counter. This does not bring in a lot of money, which is why this loan is important for his business, especially with the end of the year festivities fast approaching. These funds will enable him to buy a bale of mixed clothing to cater for the celebrations. He will save up the profit that the loan will bring in, to expand his business and the remainder will enable him to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mtandao Group

texts.en:
This group of six men and two women farmers is called Mtandao. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Francis 44 years old and is married with seven children who go to school. He is the one raising his hand in the picture and has been a member of this group for three years. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains and he hopes to implement better farming methods to increase the farm yields. It is for this reason that Francis is asking for a loan. He intends to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to be used on his one-acre farm to grow maize, millet and sorghum. He is optimistic that he will obtain enough food from the yields for his family and sell the surplus to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 23-year-old widow and mother of 2 sons. She is very talented, and excels in the work of hand embroidery. 

She started her work after the death of her husband two years ago. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people living around her. In this way, she manages to provide for her sons. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more material in bulk such as reels of thread in different colors, packs of needles, sequins, pearls, etc. This compelled her to contact BRAC and apply for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees. 

In this way she will able to complete the orders on time. Sidra intends to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family and on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more material in bulk such as thread, packs of needles, sequins, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Holiness Group

texts.en:
Saidi, who is in his late 20s, is single and has one son, who is still small. Saidi has been running a butcher business for three years now. He works from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Saidi’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use it to buy cow's meat, and to start selling fish in his butcher shop. He dreams of having an international butcher with electrical cutter.

Saidi will share this loan with his loan group, “Holiness,” which is comprised of five members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cow's meat and to start  selling fish in his butcher shop.
